QUOTE: The ideal attitude is to be physically loose and mentally tight.

QUOTE: I don't think it's a good attitude in your life to feel that you have to be rich to have self-esteem.

QUOTE: By making a comeback, I'm changing the attitude of people toward me. If I'd known that people would react so enthusiastically, I'd have done it years ago.

QUOTE: Beauty has a lot to do with character.
AUTHOR: Kevyn Aucoin

QUOTE: There is no definition of beauty, but when you can see someone's spirit coming through, something unexplainable, that's beautiful to me.
AUTHOR: Liv Tyler

QUOTE: For me the greatest beauty always lies in the greatest clarity.
AUTHOR: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

QUOTE: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
AUTHOR: Saint Augustine

QUOTE: I define nothing. Not beauty, not patriotism. I take each thing as it is, without prior rules about what it should be.
AUTHOR: Bob Dylan

QUOTE: Beauty is worse than wine, it intoxicates both the holder and beholder.
AUTHOR: Aldous Huxley

QUOTE: Beauty in things exists in the mind which contemplates them.
AUTHOR: David Hume

QUOTE: I do not have much patience with a thing of beauty that must be explained to be understood. If it does need additional interpretation by someone other than the creator, then I question whether it has fulfilled its purpose.
AUTHOR: Charlie Chaplin

QUOTE: I don't think of all the misery but of the beauty that still remains.
AUTHOR: Anne Frank

QUOTE: Beauty is not caused. It is.
AUTHOR: Emily Dickinson

QUOTE: Beauty is truth's smile when she beholds her own face in a perfect mirror.
AUTHOR: Rabindranath Tagore

QUOTE: Beauty is everywhere a welcome guest.
AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

QUOTE: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.
AUTHOR: Leo Tolstoy

QUOTE: A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
AUTHOR: Jacqueline Bisset

QUOTE: Beauty, n: the power by which a woman charms a lover and terrifies a husband.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: Dear God! how beauty varies in nature and art. In a woman the flesh must be like marble in a statue the marble must be like flesh.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: Beauty doesn't need ornaments. Softness can't bear the weight of ornaments.
AUTHOR: Munshi Premchand

QUOTE: Beauty is in the heart of the beholder.
AUTHOR: H. G. Wells

QUOTE: Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.
AUTHOR: Charles Lamb

QUOTE: Every year of my life I grow more convinced that it is wisest and best to fix our attention on the beautiful and the good, and dwell as little as possible on the evil and the false.
AUTHOR: Richard Cecil

QUOTE: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.
AUTHOR: Charles Kingsley

QUOTE: Beauty is the promise of happiness.
AUTHOR: Edmund Burke

QUOTE: We live in a wonderful world that is full of beauty, charm and adventure. There is no end to the adventures that we can have if only we seek them with our eyes open.
AUTHOR: Jawaharlal Nehru

QUOTE: Imagination disposes of everything it creates beauty, justice, and happiness, which are everything in this world.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: A women's greatest asset is her beauty.
AUTHOR: Alex Comfort

QUOTE: Beauty is indeed a good gift of God but that the good may not think it a great good, God dispenses it even to the wicked.
AUTHOR: Saint Augustine

QUOTE: Beauty is power a smile is its sword.
AUTHOR: John Ray

QUOTE: Beauty itself is but the sensible image of the Infinite.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: If you look closely at a tree you'll notice it's knots and dead branches, just like our bodies. What we learn is that beauty and imperfection go together wonderfully.
AUTHOR: Matthew Fox

QUOTE: Beauty is ever to the lonely mind a shadow fleeting she is never plain. She is a visitor who leaves behind the gift of grief, the souvenir of pain.
AUTHOR: Christopher Morley

QUOTE: Beauty is only temporary, but your mind lasts you a lifetime.
AUTHOR: Alicia Machado

QUOTE: Beauty is a fragile gift.
AUTHOR: Ovid

QUOTE: Beauty saves. Beauty heals. Beauty motivates. Beauty unites. Beauty returns us to our origins, and here lies the ultimate act of saving, of healing, of overcoming dualism.
AUTHOR: Matthew Fox

QUOTE: In every man's heart there is a secret nerve that answers to the vibrations of beauty.
AUTHOR: Christopher Morley

QUOTE: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.
AUTHOR: John Donne

QUOTE: I don't need plastic in my body to validate me as a woman.
AUTHOR: Courtney Love

QUOTE: I gave my beauty and my youth to men. I am going to give my wisdom and experience to animals.
AUTHOR: Brigitte Bardot

QUOTE: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.
AUTHOR: Joan Collins

QUOTE: In youth and beauty, wisdom is but rare!
AUTHOR: Homer

QUOTE: Heat cannot be separated from fire, or beauty from The Eternal.
AUTHOR: Dante Alighieri

QUOTE: Having inner beauty is something you develop on your own, and I like to think I have that.
AUTHOR: Cindy Margolis

QUOTE: Beauty is less important than quality.
AUTHOR: Eugene Ormandy

QUOTE: There is a kind of beauty in imperfection.
AUTHOR: Conrad Hall

QUOTE: When virtue and modesty enlighten her charms, the lustre of a beautiful woman is brighter than the stars of heaven, and the influence of her power it is in vain to resist.
AUTHOR: Akhenaton

QUOTE: Beauty is variable, ugliness is constant.
AUTHOR: Douglas Horton

QUOTE: 'Handsome' means many things to many people. If people consider me handsome, I feel flattered - and have my parents to thank for it. Realistically, it doesn't hurt to be good-looking, especially in this business.
AUTHOR: Richard Chamberlain

QUOTE: My mother always called me an ugly weed, so I never was aware of anything until I was older. Plain girls should have someone telling them they are beautiful. Sometimes this works miracles.
AUTHOR: Hedy Lamarr

QUOTE: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
AUTHOR: Christian Dior

QUOTE: Beauty is our weapon against nature by it we make objects, giving them limit, symmetry, proportion. Beauty halts and freezes the melting flux of nature.
AUTHOR: Camille Paglia

QUOTE: Beauty is whatever gives joy.
AUTHOR: Edna St. Vincent Millay

QUOTE: There is no personal achievement in being born beautiful.
AUTHOR: Loretta Young

QUOTE: The love of beauty in its multiple forms is the noblest gift of the human cerebrum.
AUTHOR: Alexis Carrel

QUOTE: Beauty is the first present nature gives to women and the first it takes away.
AUTHOR: Fay Weldon

QUOTE: Some guys say beauty is only skin deep. But when you walk into a party, you don't see somebody's brain. The initial contact has to be the sniffing.
AUTHOR: James Caan

QUOTE: We are learning, too, that the love of beauty is one of Nature's greatest healers.
AUTHOR: Ellsworth Huntington

QUOTE: I sincerely feel that beauty largely comes from within.
AUTHOR: Christy Turlington

QUOTE: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
AUTHOR: Maria Mitchell

QUOTE: Even in the centuries which appear to us to be the most monstrous and foolish, the immortal appetite for beauty has always found satisfaction.
AUTHOR: Charles Baudelaire

QUOTE: You can only perceive real beauty in a person as they get older.
AUTHOR: Anouk Aimee

QUOTE: Inner beauty should be the most important part of improving one's self.
AUTHOR: Priscilla Presley

QUOTE: What beauty is, I know not, though it adheres to many things.
AUTHOR: Albrecht Durer

QUOTE: Though beauty gives you a weird sense of entitlement, it's rather frightening and threatening to have others ascribe such importance to something you know you're just renting for a while.
AUTHOR: Candice Bergen

QUOTE: Things are beautiful if you love them.
AUTHOR: Jean Anouilh

QUOTE: The real sin against life is to abuse and destroy beauty, even one's own even more, one's own, for that has been put in our care and we are responsible for its well-being.
AUTHOR: Katherine Anne Porter

QUOTE: Real beauty knocks you a little bit off kilter.
AUTHOR: David Byrne

QUOTE: Integrity reveals beauty.
AUTHOR: Thomas Leonard

QUOTE: If you get simple beauty and naught else, you get about the best thing God invents.
AUTHOR: Robert Browning

QUOTE: Goodness is beauty in the best estate.
AUTHOR: Christopher Marlowe

QUOTE: Our hearts were drunk with a beauty Our eyes could never see.
AUTHOR: George William Russell

QUOTE: Like charity, I believe glamour should begin at home.
AUTHOR: Loretta Young

QUOTE: How goodness heightens beauty!
AUTHOR: Milan Kundera

QUOTE: Because beauty isn't enough, there must be something more.
AUTHOR: Eva Herzigova

QUOTE: Taking joy in living is a woman's best cosmetic.
AUTHOR: Rosalind Russell

QUOTE: Without realizing it, the individual composes his life according to the laws of beauty even in times of greatest distress.
AUTHOR: Milan Kundera

QUOTE: I can't live without my beauty products. I love to be in my bathroom with my candles lit, morning, noon and night. I like taking hot baths and hot showers, using my body scrubs and lotions.
AUTHOR: Traci Bingham

QUOTE: Beauty is one of the rare things which does not lead to doubt of God.
AUTHOR: Jean Anouilh

QUOTE: I'd like to grow up and be beautiful. I know it doesn't matter, but it doesn't hurt.
AUTHOR: Kirsten Dunst

QUOTE: My dad had this philosophy that if you tell children they're beautiful and wonderful then they believe it, and they will be. So I never thought I was unattractive. But I was never one of the girls at school who had lots of boyfriends.
AUTHOR: Emily Mortimer

QUOTE: O human beauty, what a dream art thou, that we should cast our life and hopes away on thee!
AUTHOR: Barry Cornwall

QUOTE: When everything else physical and mental seems to diminish, the appreciation of beauty is on the increase.
AUTHOR: Bernard Berenson

QUOTE: I was not a good-lookin' girl. I was extremely skinny. I wasn't pretty. I wasn't cool.
AUTHOR: Celine Dion

QUOTE: Beauty is only skin deep.
AUTHOR: Thomas Overbury

QUOTE: You can't really say what is beautiful about a place, but the image of the place will remain vividly with you.
AUTHOR: Tadao Ando

QUOTE: The plainer the dress, the greater luster does beauty appear.
AUTHOR: Edward F. Halifax

QUOTE: Real beauty is to be true to oneself. That's what makes me feel good.
AUTHOR: Laetitia Casta

QUOTE: It's sad when girls think they don't have anything going on except being pretty.
AUTHOR: Keri Russell

QUOTE: There is hope and a kind of beauty in there somewhere, if you look for it.
AUTHOR: H. R. Giger

QUOTE: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: The beauty of a woman is not in a facial mode but the true beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It is the caring that she lovingly gives the passion that she shows. The beauty of a woman grows with the passing years.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: Our task must be to free ourselves by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature and its beauty.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: The beauty of a woman must be seen from in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: It is time for parents to teach young people early on that in diversity there is beauty and there is strength.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: When I admire the wonders of a sunset or the beauty of the moon, my soul expands in the worship of the creator.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
AUTHOR: Chanakya

QUOTE: The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries or the way she combs her hair.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: Wisdom I know is social. She seeks her fellows. But Beauty is jealous, and illy bears the presence of a rival.
AUTHOR: Thomas Jefferson

QUOTE: Beauty of whatever kind, in its supreme development, invariably excites the sensitive soul to tears.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: There is something terribly morbid in the modern sympathy with pain. One should sympathise with the colour, the beauty, the joy of life. The less said about life's sores the better.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: Love is the beauty of the soul.
AUTHOR: Saint Augustine

QUOTE: Beauty is how you feel inside, and it reflects in your eyes. It is not something physical.
AUTHOR: Sophia Loren

QUOTE: Beauty without expression is boring.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Beauty without grace is the hook without the bait.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: We find delight in the beauty and happiness of children that makes the heart too big for the body.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: It is cruel, you know, that music should be so beautiful. It has the beauty of loneliness of pain: of strength and freedom. The beauty of disappointment and never-satisfied love. The cruel beauty of nature and everlasting beauty of monotony.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Britten

QUOTE: Everybody needs beauty as well as bread, places to play in and pray in, where nature may heal and give strength to body and soul.
AUTHOR: John Muir

QUOTE: Beauty is an outward gift, which is seldom despised, except by those to whom it has been refused.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: As we grow old, the beauty steals inward.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: A healthful hunger for a great idea is the beauty and blessedness of life.
AUTHOR: Jean Ingelow

QUOTE: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
AUTHOR: Marilyn Monroe

QUOTE: Beauty and femininity are ageless and can't be contrived, and glamour, although the manufacturers won't like this, cannot be manufactured. Not real glamour it's based on femininity.
AUTHOR: Marilyn Monroe

QUOTE: When I am working on a problem, I never think about beauty but when I have finished, if the solution is not beautiful, I know it is wrong.
AUTHOR: R. Buckminster Fuller

QUOTE: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
AUTHOR: Socrates

QUOTE: Beauty is the bait which with delight allures man to enlarge his kind.
AUTHOR: Socrates

QUOTE: Loneliness adds beauty to life. It puts a special burn on sunsets and makes night air smell better.
AUTHOR: Henry Rollins

QUOTE: The perception of beauty is a moral test.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: For every moment of triumph, for every instance of beauty, many souls must be trampled.
AUTHOR: Hunter S. Thompson

QUOTE: Alas! how little does the memory of these human inhabitants enhance the beauty of the landscape!
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: Poetry is the rhythmical creation of beauty in words.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
AUTHOR: Rumi

QUOTE: Only on paper has humanity yet achieved glory, beauty, truth, knowledge, virtue, and abiding love.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: Beauty is a short-lived tyranny.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
AUTHOR: John Keats

QUOTE: It is not sufficient to see and to know the beauty of a work. We must feel and be affected by it.

QUOTE: Beauty is mysterious as well as terrible. God and devil are fighting there, and the battlefield is the heart of man.
AUTHOR: Fyodor Dostoevsky

AUTHOR: Deepak Chopra

QUOTE: Anything in any way beautiful derives its beauty from itself and asks nothing beyond itself. Praise is no part of it, for nothing is made worse or better by praise.
AUTHOR: Marcus Aurelius

QUOTE: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Schiller

QUOTE: I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of Beauty.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: I am a thing of beauty.
AUTHOR: Frank Sinatra

QUOTE: The beauty, the poetry of the fear in their eyes. I didn't mind going to jail for, what, five, six hours? It was absolutely worth it.

QUOTE: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude, and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.

QUOTE: Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead.

QUOTE: It is not so much for its beauty that the forest makes a claim upon men's hearts, as for that subtle something, that quality of air that emanation from old trees, that so wonderfully changes and renews a weary spirit.

QUOTE: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.

QUOTE: Beauty is the greatest seducer of man.

QUOTE: I think permitting the game to become too physical takes away a little bit of the beauty.

QUOTE: Be sure what you want and be sure about yourself. Fashion is not just beauty, it's about good attitude. You have to believe in yourself and be strong.

QUOTE: If truth is beauty, how come no one has their hair done in the library?
AUTHOR: Lily Tomlin

QUOTE: Everyone has their own insecurities, regardless of how you look or how people perceive you, but sometimes people give their insecurities too much power. Defining beauty is simply a matter of opinion. For me, real beauty has very little to do with the structure of someone's face or body.

QUOTE: Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.

QUOTE: It was one of those evenings when men feel that truth, goodness and beauty are one. In the morning, when they commit their discovery to paper, when others read it written there, it looks wholly ridiculous.

QUOTE: It's not beauty but fine qualities, my girl, that keep a husband.
AUTHOR: Euripides

QUOTE: What would be ugly in a garden constitutes beauty in a mountain.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: Do you know the difference between a beautiful woman and a charming one? A beauty is a woman you notice, a charmer is one who notices you.

QUOTE: Art is not the application of a canon of beauty but what the instinct and the brain can conceive beyond any canon. When we love a woman we don't start measuring her limbs.

QUOTE: Great perils have this beauty, that they bring to light the fraternity of strangers.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: The books that help you most are those which make you think that most. The hardest way of learning is that of easy reading but a great book that comes from a great thinker is a ship of thought, deep freighted with truth and beauty.

QUOTE: The ideal and the beautiful are identical the ideal corresponds to the idea, and beauty to form hence idea and substance are cognate.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age - as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.
AUTHOR: Phyllis Diller

QUOTE: What a man does for pay is of little significance. What he is, as a sensitive instrument responsive to the world's beauty, is everything!

QUOTE: Celibacy is not just a matter of not having sex. It is a way of admiring a person for their humanity, maybe even for their beauty.

QUOTE: Endurance is nobler than strength, and patience than beauty.
AUTHOR: John Ruskin

QUOTE: Secrecy is the element of all goodness even virtue, even beauty is mysterious.
AUTHOR: Thomas Carlyle

QUOTE: Art can never exist without naked beauty displayed.
AUTHOR: William Blake

QUOTE: Exuberance is beauty.
AUTHOR: William Blake

QUOTE: It's a good thing that beauty is only skin deep, or I'd be rotten to the core.
AUTHOR: Phyllis Diller

QUOTE: Sexiness wears thin after a while and beauty fades, but to be married to a man who makes you laugh every day, ah, now that's a real treat.
AUTHOR: Joanne Woodward

QUOTE: Photography records the gamut of feelings written on the human face, the beauty of the earth and skies that man has inherited, and the wealth and confusion man has created. It is a major force in explaining man to man.
AUTHOR: Edward Steichen

QUOTE: Most sets of values would give rise to universes that, although they might be very beautiful, would contain no one able to wonder at that beauty.
AUTHOR: Stephen Hawking

QUOTE: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: There are no better cosmetics than a severe temperance and purity, modesty and humility, a gracious temper and calmness of spirit and there is no true beauty without the signatures of these graces in the very countenance.

QUOTE: Beauty is an ecstasy it is as simple as hunger. There is really nothing to be said about it. It is like the perfume of a rose: you can smell it and that is all.

QUOTE: I can barely conceive of a type of beauty in which there is no Melancholy.
AUTHOR: Charles Baudelaire

QUOTE: That which you create in beauty and goodness and truth lives on for all time to come. Don't spend your life accumulating material objects that will only turn to dust and ashes.

QUOTE: A person however learned and qualified in his life's work in whom gratitude is absent, is devoid of that beauty of character which makes personality fragrant.

QUOTE: Facts which at first seem improbable will, even on scant explanation, drop the cloak which has hidden them and stand forth in naked and simple beauty.

QUOTE: Beauty in distress is much the most affecting beauty.

QUOTE: The beauty of independence, departure, actions that rely on themselves.
AUTHOR: Walt Whitman

QUOTE: Beauty makes idiots sad and wise men merry.
AUTHOR: George Jean Nathan

QUOTE: Look up, laugh loud, talk big, keep the color in your cheek and the fire in your eye, adorn your person, maintain your health, your beauty and your animal spirits.
AUTHOR: William Hazlitt

QUOTE: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.
AUTHOR: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

QUOTE: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: When I say that human beings are just gene machines, one shouldn't put too much emphasis on the word 'just.' There is a very great deal of complication, and indeed beauty in being a gene machine.

QUOTE: It is the addition of strangeness to beauty that constitutes the romantic character in art.
AUTHOR: Walter Hagen

QUOTE: Beauty may be skin deep, but ugly goes clear to the bone.
AUTHOR: Redd Foxx

QUOTE: Beauty is in the eye of the beer holder.
AUTHOR: Kinky Friedman

QUOTE: Teach us that wealth is not elegance, that profusion is not magnificence, that splendor is not beauty.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: I also became close to nature, and am now able to appreciate the beauty with which this world is endowed.
AUTHOR: James Dean

QUOTE: In marriage do thou be wise: prefer the person before money, virtue before beauty, the mind before the body then thou hast a wife, a friend, a companion, a second self.
AUTHOR: William Penn

QUOTE: That's one of the nice things. I mean, part of the beauty of me is that I'm very rich. So if I need $600 million, I can put $600 million myself. That's a huge advantage. I must tell you, that's a huge advantage over the other candidates.
AUTHOR: Donald Trump

QUOTE: At fifteen, beauty and talent do not exist there can only be promise of the coming woman.
AUTHOR: Honore de Balzac

QUOTE: Children, dear and loving children, can alone console a woman for the loss of her beauty.
AUTHOR: Honore de Balzac

QUOTE: If in my youth I had realized that the sustaining splendour of beauty of with which I was in love would one day flood back into my heart, there to ignite a flame that would torture me without end, how gladly would I have put out the light in my eyes.
AUTHOR: Michelangelo

QUOTE: A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth or perfection is a poverty-stricken day and a succession of such days is fatal to human life.

QUOTE: At some point in life the world's beauty becomes enough. You don't need to photograph, paint or even remember it. It is enough.

QUOTE: Light, God's eldest daughter, is a principal beauty in a building.
AUTHOR: Thomas Fuller

QUOTE: Beauty is about perception, not about make-up. I think the beginning of all beauty is knowing and liking oneself. You can't put on make-up, or dress yourself, or do you hair with any sort of fun or joy if you're doing it from a position of correction.
AUTHOR: Kevyn Aucoin

QUOTE: That's why I began doing makeup in the first place: I was hoping that through helping people see the beauty in themselves, I could try and find it in me.
AUTHOR: Kevyn Aucoin

QUOTE: Beauty is only skin deep. I think what's really important is finding a balance of mind, body and spirit.
AUTHOR: Jennifer Lopez

QUOTE: When I tried to play something and screwed up, I'd hear some other note that would come into play. Then I started trying different things to find the beauty in it.
AUTHOR: Dimebag Darrell

QUOTE: The most common error made in matters of appearance is the belief that one should disdain the superficial and let the true beauty of one's soul shine through. If there are places on your body where this is a possibility, you are not attractive - you are leaking.
AUTHOR: Charles Lamb

QUOTE: The terrifying and edible beauty of Art Nouveau architecture.
AUTHOR: Salvador Dali

QUOTE: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.
AUTHOR: Christopher Marlowe

QUOTE: Through loyalty to the past, our mind refuses to realize that tomorrow's joy is possible only if today's makes way for it that each wave owes the beauty of its line only to the withdrawal of the preceding one.
AUTHOR: Andre Gide

QUOTE: There is no excellent beauty that hath not some strangeness in the proportion.
AUTHOR: Francis Bacon

QUOTE: Although beauty may be in the eye of the beholder, the feeling of being beautiful exists solely in the mind of the beheld.
AUTHOR: Martha Beck

QUOTE: Beauty, to me, is about being comfortable in your own skin. That, or a kick-ass red lipstick.
AUTHOR: Gwyneth Paltrow

QUOTE: The human mind is capable of excitement without the application of gross and violent stimulants and he must have a very faint perception of its beauty and dignity who does not know this.
AUTHOR: William Wordsworth

QUOTE: Beauty deprived of its proper foils and adjuncts ceases to be enjoyed as beauty, just as light deprived of all shadows ceases to be enjoyed as light.
AUTHOR: John Ruskin

QUOTE: The kind of beauty I want most is the hard-to-get kind that comes from within - strength, courage, dignity.
AUTHOR: Ruby Dee

QUOTE: Beauty for some provides escape, who gain a happiness in eyeing the gorgeous buttocks of the ape or Autumn sunsets exquisitely dying.
AUTHOR: Langston Hughes

QUOTE: To give pain is the tyranny to make happy, the true empire of beauty.
AUTHOR: Samuel Butler

QUOTE: The beauty of the world, which is so soon to perish, has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder.
AUTHOR: Virginia Woolf

QUOTE: Every beauty which is seen here by persons of perception resembles more than anything else that celestial source from which we all are come.
AUTHOR: Michelangelo

QUOTE: Beauty always promises, but never gives anything.
AUTHOR: Simone Weil

QUOTE: To look almost pretty is an acquisition of higher delight to a girl who has been looking plain for the first fifteen years of her life than a beauty from her cradle can ever receive.
AUTHOR: Jane Austen

QUOTE: Poets say science takes away from the beauty of the stars - mere globs of gas atoms. I, too, can see the stars on a desert night, and feel them. But do I see less or more?
AUTHOR: Richard P. Feynman

QUOTE: We especially need imagination in science. It is not all mathematics, nor all logic, but it is somewhat beauty and poetry.
AUTHOR: Maria Montessori

QUOTE: The architect should strive continually to simplify the ensemble of the rooms should then be carefully considered that comfort and utility may go hand in hand with beauty.
AUTHOR: Frank Lloyd Wright

QUOTE: It is art that makes life, makes interest, makes importance... and I know of no substitute whatever for the force and beauty of its process.
AUTHOR: Henry James

QUOTE: It is dangerous for mortal beauty, or terrestrial virtue, to be examined by too strong a light. The torch of Truth shows much that we cannot, and all that we would not, see.
AUTHOR: Samuel Johnson

QUOTE: Poetry is something to make us wiser and better, by continually revealing those types of beauty and truth, which God has set in all men's souls.
AUTHOR: James Russell Lowell

QUOTE: I don't like people who have never fallen or stumbled. Their virtue is lifeless and it isn't of much value. Life hasn't revealed its beauty to them.
AUTHOR: Boris Pasternak

QUOTE: Taught from infancy that beauty is woman's sceptre, the mind shapes itself to the body, and roaming round its gilt cage, only seeks to adorn its prison.

QUOTE: In the practice of tolerance, one's enemy is the best teacher.
AUTHOR: Dalai Lama

QUOTE: I believe that a simple and unassuming manner of life is best for everyone, best both for the body and the mind.
AUTHOR: Albert Einstein

QUOTE: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
AUTHOR: Ernest Hemingway

QUOTE: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.

QUOTE: I do the very best I know how - the very best I can and I mean to keep on doing so until the end.

QUOTE: The best road to progress is freedom's road.

QUOTE: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.

QUOTE: Learn to say 'no' to the good so you can say 'yes' to the best.

QUOTE: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.

QUOTE: In times of great stress or adversity, it's always best to keep busy, to plow your anger and your energy into something positive.

QUOTE: At his best, man is the noblest of all animals separated from law and justice he is the worst.

QUOTE: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.

QUOTE: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

QUOTE: The best way to predict the future is to create it.

QUOTE: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.

QUOTE: It's a funny thing about life if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.

QUOTE: If you want to go somewhere, it is best to find someone who has already been there.

QUOTE: The best way to keep one's word is not to give it.

QUOTE: To give and then not feel that one has given is the very best of all ways of giving.

QUOTE: Living well is the best revenge.

QUOTE: If a man does his best, what else is there?

QUOTE: Clever men are good, but they are not the best.

QUOTE: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.

QUOTE: I always prefer to believe the best of everybody, it saves so much trouble.

QUOTE: The best thing to do with the best things in life is to give them up.

QUOTE: The worst men often give the best advice.

QUOTE: We are at our very best, and we are happiest, when we are fully engaged in work we enjoy on the journey toward the goal we've established for ourselves. It gives meaning to our time off and comfort to our sleep. It makes everything else in life so wonderful, so worthwhile.
AUTHOR: Earl Nightingale

QUOTE: The best thing about animals is that they don't talk much.

QUOTE: I have found the best way to give advice to your children is to find out what they want and then advise them to do it.

QUOTE: The best things in life are unexpected - because there were no expectations.

QUOTE: I will do my best. That is all I can do. I ask for your help - and God's.

QUOTE: Best to live lightly, unthinkingly.

QUOTE: The best doctors in the world are Doctor Diet, Doctor Quiet, and Doctor Merryman.

QUOTE: To love and win is the best thing. To love and lose, the next best.

QUOTE: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.

QUOTE: He who has done his best for his own time has lived for all times.

QUOTE: You'll live. Only the best get killed.

QUOTE: This is the precept by which I have lived: Prepare for the worst expect the best and take what comes.

QUOTE: Most of the things we decide are not what we know to be the best. We say yes, merely because we are driven into a corner and must say something.

QUOTE: There is only one real sin and that is to persuade oneself that the second best is anything but second best.

QUOTE: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.

QUOTE: Since we live in this world, we have to do our best for this world.

QUOTE: Enthusiasm is the best protection in any situation. Wholeheartedness is contagious. Give yourself, if you wish to get others.

QUOTE: The best way to navigate through life is to give up all of our controls.

QUOTE: When you do not know what you are doing and what you are doing is the best - that is inspiration.

QUOTE: Just do what you do best.

QUOTE: I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
AUTHOR: Buddha

QUOTE: We must develop and maintain the capacity to forgive. He who is devoid of the power to forgive is devoid of the power to love. There is some good in the worst of us and some evil in the best of us. When we discover this, we are less prone to hate our enemies.

QUOTE: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: God always gives His best to those who leave the choice with him.
AUTHOR: Jim Elliot

QUOTE: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
AUTHOR: Og Mandino

QUOTE: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.

QUOTE: My formula for living is quite simple. I get up in the morning and I go to bed at night. In between, I occupy myself as best I can.

QUOTE: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.

QUOTE: The things I want to know are in books my best friend is the man who'll get me a book I ain't read.

QUOTE: You can't stop loving or wanting to love because when its right it's the best thing in the world. When you're in a relationship and its good, even if nothing else in your life is right, you feel like your whole world is complete.

QUOTE: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
AUTHOR: Audrey Hepburn

QUOTE: Government, even in its best state, is but a necessary evil in its worst state, an intolerable one.

QUOTE: Speak when you are angry and you will make the best speech you will ever regret.

QUOTE: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.

QUOTE: I believe God is managing affairs and that He doesn't need any advice from me. With God in charge, I believe everything will work out for the best in the end. So what is there to worry about.

QUOTE: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.

QUOTE: My dream is of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope of earth.

QUOTE: Common looking people are the best in the world: that is the reason the Lord makes so many of them.

QUOTE: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.

QUOTE: The age of a woman doesn't mean a thing. The best tunes are played on the oldest fiddles.

QUOTE: I am prepared for the worst, but hope for the best.

QUOTE: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.

QUOTE: The best proof of love is trust.

QUOTE: For a people who are free, and who mean to remain so, a well-organized and armed militia is their best security.

QUOTE: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.

QUOTE: The best way to destroy an enemy is to make him a friend.

QUOTE: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own. You do not blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the president. You realize that you control your own destiny.

QUOTE: I never had a policy I have just tried to do my very best each and every day.

QUOTE: I want it said of me by those who knew me best, that I always plucked a thistle and planted a flower where I thought a flower would grow.

QUOTE: He who knows best knows how little he knows.

QUOTE: Walking is the best possible exercise. Habituate yourself to walk very fast.

And that is as it should be, because Death is very likely the single best invention of Life. It is Life's change agent. It clears out the old to make way for the new.

QUOTE: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.

QUOTE: The best weapon against an enemy is another enemy.

QUOTE: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.

QUOTE: He who laughs best today, will also laughs last.

QUOTE: But what we can do, as flawed as we are, is still see God in other people, and do our best to help them find their own grace. That's what I strive to do, that's what I pray to do every day.

AUTHOR: Eminem

QUOTE: My husband and I are best of friends first and foremost. We fight like cats and dogs, but never stay mad for long. I was lucky to find him, he is in every way, my soulmate.

QUOTE: The best things and best people rise out of their separateness I'm against a homogenized society because I want the cream to rise.

QUOTE: I did not wish to take a cabin passage, but rather to go before the mast and on the deck of the world, for there I could best see the moonlight amid the mountains. I do not wish to go below now.

QUOTE: Best way to get rid of kitchen odors: Eat out.

QUOTE: It is best to avoid the beginnings of evil.

QUOTE: I didn't see it then, but it turned out that getting fired from Apple was the best thing that could have ever happened to me. The heaviness of being successful was replaced by the lightness of being a beginner again, less sure about everything. It freed me to enter one of the most creative periods of my life.
AUTHOR: Steve Jobs

QUOTE: Nothing goes by luck in composition. It allows of no tricks. The best you can write will be the best you are.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: One way or another, we all have to find what best fosters the flowering of our humanity in this contemporary life, and dedicate ourselves to that.

QUOTE: The man with the best job in the country is the vice-president. All he has to do is get up every morning and say, 'How is the president?'

QUOTE: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.

AUTHOR: Joseph Smith, Jr.

QUOTE: It is only necessary to have courage, for strength without self-confidence is useless.
AUTHOR: Giacomo Casanova

QUOTE: We have a powerful potential in out youth, and we must have the courage to change old ideas and practices so that we may direct their power toward good ends.
AUTHOR: Mary McLeod Bethune

QUOTE: Courage - a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.
AUTHOR: William Tecumseh Sherman

QUOTE: If you are lucky enough to find a way of life you love, you have to find the courage to live it.
AUTHOR: John Irving

QUOTE: Courage is not the absence of despair it is, rather, the capacity to move ahead in spite of despair.
AUTHOR: Rollo May

QUOTE: Courage is being afraid but going on anyhow.
AUTHOR: Dan Rather

QUOTE: Clear thinking requires courage rather than intelligence.
AUTHOR: Thomas Szasz

QUOTE: People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest.
AUTHOR: Hermann Hesse

QUOTE: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
AUTHOR: Saint Francis de Sales

QUOTE: The best protection any woman can have... is courage.
AUTHOR: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

QUOTE: The trials on the road to world harmony are no greater than the courage of those who accept the challenge.
AUTHOR: Carl Lewis

QUOTE: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: We gain strength, and courage, and confidence by each experience in which we really stop to look fear in the face... we must do that which we think we cannot.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
AUTHOR: Walt Disney

QUOTE: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
AUTHOR: Reinhold Niebuhr

QUOTE: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
AUTHOR: Bruce Lee

QUOTE: My great hope is to laugh as much as I cry to get my work done and try to love somebody and have the courage to accept the love in return.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naive or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman.
AUTHOR: Anais Nin

QUOTE: You have to accept whatever comes and the only important thing is that you meet it with courage and with the best that you have to give.
AUTHOR: Eleanor Roosevelt

QUOTE: Courage means to keep working a relationship, to continue seeking solutions to difficult problems, and to stay focused during stressful periods.
AUTHOR: Denis Waitley

QUOTE: History, despite its wrenching pain, cannot be unlived, but if faced with courage, need not be lived again.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: One isn't necessarily born with courage, but one is born with potential. Without courage, we cannot practice any other virtue with consistency. We can't be kind, true, merciful, generous, or honest.
AUTHOR: Maya Angelou

QUOTE: You don't develop courage by being happy in your relationships everyday. You develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
AUTHOR: Epicurus

QUOTE: Above all, we must realize that no arsenal, or no weapon in the arsenals of the world, is so formidable as the will and moral courage of free men and women. It is a weapon our adversaries in today's world do not have.
AUTHOR: Ronald Reagan

QUOTE: It is curious that physical courage should be so common in the world and moral courage so rare.
AUTHOR: Mark Twain

QUOTE: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
AUTHOR: Confucius

QUOTE: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities... because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
AUTHOR: Winston Churchill

QUOTE: A nation which has forgotten the quality of courage which in the past has been brought to public life is not as likely to insist upon or regard that quality in its chosen leaders today - and in fact we have forgotten.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: A man of courage is also full of faith.
AUTHOR: Marcus Tullius Cicero

QUOTE: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
AUTHOR: Orison Swett Marden

QUOTE: Do you really think it is weakness that yields to temptation? I tell you that there are terrible temptations which it requires strength, strength and courage to yield to.
AUTHOR: Oscar Wilde

QUOTE: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
AUTHOR: e. e. cummings

QUOTE: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of a final moment but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: He who has faith has... an inward reservoir of courage, hope, confidence, calmness, and assuring trust that all will come out well - even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.
AUTHOR: B. C. Forbes

QUOTE: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
AUTHOR: Robert Green Ingersoll

QUOTE: Every man has his own courage, and is betrayed because he seeks in himself the courage of other persons.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: You may not always have a comfortable life and you will not always be able to solve all of the world's problems at once but don't ever underestimate the importance you can have because history has shown us that courage can be contagious and hope can take on a life of its own.
AUTHOR: Michelle Obama

QUOTE: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.
AUTHOR: Thomas S. Monson

QUOTE: Courage is a mean with regard to fear and confidence.
AUTHOR: Aristotle

QUOTE: Don't wish me happiness - I don't expect to be happy it's gotten beyond that, somehow. Wish me courage and strength and a sense of humor - I will need them all.
AUTHOR: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

QUOTE: Simulated disorder postulates perfect discipline simulated fear postulates courage simulated weakness postulates strength.
AUTHOR: Lao Tzu

QUOTE: I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.
AUTHOR: Marilyn Monroe

QUOTE: My message, especially to young people is to have courage to think differently, courage to invent, to travel the unexplored path, courage to discover the impossible and to conquer the problems and succeed. These are great qualities that they must work towards. This is my message to the young people.
AUTHOR: Abdul Kalam

QUOTE: A man of great common sense and good taste - meaning thereby a man without originality or moral courage.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: It is only through labor and painful effort, by grim energy and resolute courage, that we move on to better things.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: I never thought much of the courage of a lion tamer. Inside the cage he is at least safe from people.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: True courage is being afraid, and going ahead and doing your job anyhow, that's what courage is.
AUTHOR: Norman Schwarzkopf

QUOTE: Courtesy is as much a mark of a gentleman as courage.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: He's a man of great common sense and good taste - meaning thereby a man without originality or moral courage.
AUTHOR: George Bernard Shaw

QUOTE: Courage is like love it must have hope for nourishment.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
AUTHOR: Plato

QUOTE: Real nobility is based on scorn, courage, and profound indifference.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.
AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

QUOTE: My message to you all is of hope, courage and confidence. Let us mobilize all our resources in a systematic and organized way and tackle the grave issues that confront us with grim determination and discipline worthy of a great nation.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

QUOTE: Believers, look up - take courage. The angels are nearer than you think.
AUTHOR: Billy Graham

QUOTE: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right even though I think it is hopeless.
AUTHOR: Chester W. Nimitz

QUOTE: All of us have moments in our lives that test our courage. Taking children into a house with a white carpet is one of them.
AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

QUOTE: Change will never happen when people lack the ability and courage to see themselves for who they are.
AUTHOR: Bryant H. McGill

QUOTE: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude, and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
AUTHOR: Jacqueline Bisset

QUOTE: A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
AUTHOR: Jacqueline Bisset

QUOTE: Give us grace and strength to forbear and to persevere. Give us courage and gaiety and the quiet mind, spare to us our friends, soften to us our enemies.
AUTHOR: Robert Louis Stevenson

QUOTE: I have a hat. It is graceful and feminine and give me a certain dignity, as if I were attending a state funeral or something. Someday I may get up enough courage to wear it, instead of carrying it.
AUTHOR: Erma Bombeck

QUOTE: My mother taught me about the power of inspiration and courage, and she did it with a strength and a passion that I wish could be bottled.
AUTHOR: Carly Fiorina

QUOTE: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage with others.
AUTHOR: Robert Louis Stevenson

QUOTE: Most of us have far more courage than we ever dreamed we possessed.
AUTHOR: Dale Carnegie

QUOTE: Life is to be entered upon with courage.
AUTHOR: Alexis de Tocqueville

QUOTE: Every human being on this earth is born with a tragedy, and it isn't original sin. He's born with the tragedy that he has to grow up... a lot of people don't have the courage to do it.
AUTHOR: Helen Hayes

QUOTE: I've been through it all, baby, I'm mother courage.
AUTHOR: Elizabeth Taylor

QUOTE: And I love that even in the toughest moments, when we're all sweating it - when we're worried that the bill won't pass, and it seems like all is lost - Barack never lets himself get distracted by the chatter and the noise. Just like his grandmother, he just keeps getting up and moving forward... with patience and wisdom, and courage and grace.
AUTHOR: Michelle Obama

QUOTE: A wise woman recognizes when her life is out of balance and summons the courage to act to correct it, she knows the meaning of true generosity, happiness is the reward for a life lived in harmony, with a courage and grace.
AUTHOR: Suze Orman

QUOTE: We need to find the courage to say no to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
AUTHOR: Barbara de Angelis

QUOTE: Untutored courage is useless in the face of educated bullets.
AUTHOR: George S. Patton

QUOTE: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of readiness to die.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue courage is only the second virtue.
AUTHOR: Napoleon Bonaparte

QUOTE: There can be no failure to a man who has not lost his courage, his character, his self respect, or his self-confidence. He is still a King.
AUTHOR: Orison Swett Marden

QUOTE: Two qualities are indispensable: first, an intellect that, even in the darkest hour, retains some glimmerings of the inner light which leads to truth and second, the courage to follow this faint light wherever it may lead.
AUTHOR: Karl Von Clausewitz

QUOTE: Many a man will have the courage to die gallantly, but will not have the courage to say, or even to think, that the cause for which he is asked to die is an unworthy one.
AUTHOR: Bertrand Russell

QUOTE: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
AUTHOR: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

QUOTE: Healing takes courage, and we all have courage, even if we have to dig a little to find it.
AUTHOR: Tori Amos

QUOTE: Goodness is about character - integrity, honesty, kindness, generosity, moral courage, and the like. More than anything else, it is about how we treat other people.
AUTHOR: Dennis Prager

QUOTE: If human beings had genuine courage, they'd wear their costumes every day of the year, not just on Halloween.
AUTHOR: Doug Coupland

QUOTE: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.
AUTHOR: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

QUOTE: I have seen in the Halls of Congress more idealism, more humanness, more compassion, more profiles of courage than in any other institution that I have ever known.
AUTHOR: Hubert H. Humphrey

QUOTE: Courage and grace are a formidable mixture. The only place to see it is in the bullring.
AUTHOR: Marlene Dietrich

QUOTE: No matter what you think about the Iraq war, there is one thing we can all agree on for the next days - we have to salute the courage and bravery of those who are risking their lives to vote and those brave Iraqi and American soldiers fighting to protect their right to vote.
AUTHOR: Hillary Clinton

QUOTE: The courage we desire and prize is not the courage to die decently, but to live manfully.
AUTHOR: Thomas Carlyle

QUOTE: Just remaining quietly in the presence of God, listening to Him, being attentive to Him, requires a lot of courage and know-how.
AUTHOR: Thomas Merton

QUOTE: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life even in order to keep it.
AUTHOR: Gilbert K. Chesterton

QUOTE: Just as courage imperils life, fear protects it.
AUTHOR: Leonardo da Vinci

QUOTE: There can be no great courage where there is no confidence or assurance, and half the battle is in the conviction that we can do what we undertake.
AUTHOR: Orison Swett Marden

QUOTE: We need men with moral courage to speak and write their real thoughts, and to stand by their convictions, even to the very death.
AUTHOR: Robert Green Ingersoll

QUOTE: The weak in courage is strong in cunning.
AUTHOR: William Blake

QUOTE: Freedom is the sure possession of those alone who have the courage to defend it.
AUTHOR: Pericles

QUOTE: You will find as you grow older that courage is the rarest of all qualities to be found in public life.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: Every day begins with an act of courage and hope: getting out of bed.
AUTHOR: Mason Cooley

QUOTE: A team is where a boy can prove his courage on his own. A gang is where a coward goes to hide.
AUTHOR: Mickey Mantle

QUOTE: Each person has inside a basic decency and goodness. If he listens to it and acts on it, he is giving a great deal of what it is the world needs most. It is not complicated but it takes courage. It takes courage for a person to listen to his own goodness and act on it.
AUTHOR: Pablo Casals

QUOTE: It is a blessed thing that in every age some one has had the individuality enough and courage enough to stand by his own convictions.
AUTHOR: Robert Green Ingersoll

QUOTE: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice, it is conformity.
AUTHOR: Rollo May

QUOTE: Perfect courage is to do without witnesses what one would be capable of doing with the world looking on.
AUTHOR: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

QUOTE: Courage can't see around corners but goes around them anyway.
AUTHOR: Mignon McLaughlin

QUOTE: Courage and willingness to just go for it, whether it is a conversation or a spontaneous trip or trying new things that are scary - it is a really attractive quality.
AUTHOR: Alanis Morissette

QUOTE: Earth teach me to forget myself as melted snow forgets its life. Earth teach me resignation as the leaves which die in the fall. Earth teach me courage as the tree which stands all alone. Earth teach me regeneration as the seed which rises in the spring.
AUTHOR: William Alexander

QUOTE: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
AUTHOR: Mignon McLaughlin

QUOTE: Half a century ago, the amazing courage of Rosa Parks, the visionary leadership of Martin Luther King, and the inspirational actions of the civil rights movement led politicians to write equality into the law and make real the promise of America for all her citizens.
AUTHOR: David Cameron

QUOTE: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air.
AUTHOR: John Quincy Adams

QUOTE: In the Soviet army it takes more courage to retreat than advance.
AUTHOR: Joseph Stalin

QUOTE: Courage without conscience is a wild beast.
AUTHOR: Robert Green Ingersoll

QUOTE: Eccentricity has always abounded when and where strength of character had abounded and the amount of eccentricity in a society has generally been proportional to the amount of genius, mental vigor, and courage which it contained.
AUTHOR: John Stuart Mill

QUOTE: Why should we honour those that die upon the field of battle? A man may show as reckless a courage in entering into the abyss of himself.
AUTHOR: William Butler Yeats

QUOTE: Let's drink to the spirit of gallantry and courage that made a strange Heaven out of unbelievable Hell, and let's drink to the hope that one day this country of ours, which we love so much, will find dignity and greatness and peace again.
AUTHOR: Noel Coward

QUOTE: To dare to live alone is the rarest courage since there are many who had rather meet their bitterest enemy in the field, than their own hearts in their closet.
AUTHOR: Charles Caleb Colton

QUOTE: Traits like humility, courage, and empathy are easily overlooked - but it's immensely important to find them in your closest relationships.
AUTHOR: Laura Linney

QUOTE: He who knows no hardships will know no hardihood. He who faces no calamity will need no courage. Mysterious though it is, the characteristics in human nature which we love best grow in a soil with a strong mixture of troubles.
AUTHOR: Harry Emerson Fosdick

QUOTE: Valor is stability, not of legs and arms, but of courage and the soul.
AUTHOR: Michel de Montaigne

QUOTE: It is courage, courage, courage, that raises the blood of life to crimson splendor. Live bravely and present a brave front to adversity.
AUTHOR: Horace

QUOTE: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
AUTHOR: Earl Nightingale

QUOTE: Courage consists not in hazarding without fear but being resolutely minded in a just cause.
AUTHOR: Plutarch

QUOTE: To create one's world in any of the arts takes courage.
AUTHOR: Georgia O'Keeffe

QUOTE: The kind of beauty I want most is the hard-to-get kind that comes from within - strength, courage, dignity.
AUTHOR: Ruby Dee

QUOTE: Genius is talent set on fire by courage.
AUTHOR: Henry Van Dyke

QUOTE: We've begun to raise daughters more like sons... but few have the courage to raise our sons more like our daughters.
AUTHOR: Gloria Steinem

QUOTE: Despair gives courage to a coward.
AUTHOR: Thomas Fuller

QUOTE: Life is the most exciting opportunity we have. But we have one shot. You graduate from college once, and that's it. You're going out of that nest. And you have to find that courage that's deep, deep, deep in there. Every step of the way.
AUTHOR: Andrew Shue

QUOTE: He that fails in his endeavors after wealth or power will not long retain either honesty or courage.
AUTHOR: Samuel Johnson

QUOTE: Either life entails courage, or it ceases to be life.
AUTHOR: E. M. Forster

QUOTE: Courage stands halfway between cowardice and rashness, one of which is a lack, the other an excess of courage.
AUTHOR: Plutarch

QUOTE: Everyone has talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
AUTHOR: Erica Jong

QUOTE: To persevere, trusting in what hopes he has, is courage in a man.
AUTHOR: Euripides

QUOTE: Political courage is not political suicide.
AUTHOR: Arnold Schwarzenegger

QUOTE: This soul, or life within us, by no means agrees with the life outside us. If one has the courage to ask her what she thinks, she is always saying the very opposite to what other people say.
AUTHOR: Virginia Woolf

QUOTE: Courage and conviction are powerful weapons against an enemy who depends only on fists or guns. Animals know when you are afraid a coward knows when you are not.
AUTHOR: David Seabury

QUOTE: Unless a reviewer has the courage to give you unqualified praise, I say ignore the bastard.
AUTHOR: John Steinbeck

QUOTE: The strangest, most generous, and proudest of all virtues is true courage.
AUTHOR: Michel de Montaigne

QUOTE: Courage, above all things, is the first quality of a warrior.
AUTHOR: Karl Von Clausewitz

QUOTE: The amount of eccentricity in a society has generally been proportional to the amount of genius, mental vigor, and moral courage it contained. That so few now dare to be eccentric marks the chief danger of the time.
AUTHOR: John Stuart Mill

QUOTE: I beg you take courage the brave soul can mend even disaster.
AUTHOR: Catherine the Great

QUOTE: The more wit the less courage.
AUTHOR: Thomas Fuller

QUOTE: I have the responsibility of over four million people, and I am in a position to do good, to be able to bring about a new life for my people, and I will continue to move in that direction. It's a burden, but it needs to be done, and you have to have the courage and wisdom to see it through.
AUTHOR: King Abdullah II

QUOTE: Then there is a still higher type of courage - the courage to brave pain, to live with it, to never let others know of it and to still find joy in life to wake up in the morning with an enthusiasm for the day ahead.
AUTHOR: Howard Cosell

QUOTE: One man scorned and covered with scars still strove with his last ounce of courage to reach the unreachable stars and the world will be better for this.
AUTHOR: Miguel de Cervantes

QUOTE: Take chances, make mistakes. That's how you grow. Pain nourishes your courage. You have to fail in order to practice being brave.
AUTHOR: Mary Tyler Moore

QUOTE: I think my mother... made it clear that you have to live life by your own terms and you have to not worry about what other people think and you have to have the courage to do the unexpected.
AUTHOR: Caroline Kennedy

QUOTE: Courage, not compromise, brings the smile of God's approval.
AUTHOR: Thomas S. Monson

QUOTE: Leaders come in many forms, with many styles and diverse qualities. There are quiet leaders and leaders one can hear in the next county. Some find strength in eloquence, some in judgment, some in courage.
AUTHOR: John W. Gardner

QUOTE: Determination, energy, and courage appear spontaneously when we care deeply about something. We take risks that are unimaginable in any other context.
AUTHOR: Margaret J. Wheatley

QUOTE: Great tragedy has come to us, and we are meeting it with the best that is in our country, with courage and concern for others because this is America. This is who we are.
AUTHOR: George W. Bush

QUOTE: Way down deep, we're all motivated by the same urges. Cats have the courage to live by them.
AUTHOR: Jim Davis

QUOTE: Suffering! We owe to it all that is good in us, all that gives value to life we owe to it pity, we owe to it courage, we owe to it all the virtues.
AUTHOR: Anatole France

QUOTE: Failure is only postponed success as long as courage 'coaches' ambition. The habit of persistence is the habit of victory.
AUTHOR: Herbert Kaufman

QUOTE: It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
AUTHOR: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

QUOTE: Today we affirm a new commitment to live out our nation's promise through civility, courage, compassion and character.
AUTHOR: George W. Bush

QUOTE: Courage consists not in blindly overlooking danger, but in seeing it, and conquering it.
AUTHOR: Jean Paul

QUOTE: Creativity takes courage.
AUTHOR: Henri Matisse

QUOTE: Courage enlarges, cowardice diminishes resources. In desperate straits the fears of the timid aggravate the dangers that imperil the brave.
AUTHOR: Christian Nestell Bovee

QUOTE: If we survive danger it steels our courage more than anything else.
AUTHOR: Reinhold Niebuhr

QUOTE: There are pretenders to piety as well as to courage.
AUTHOR: Moliere

QUOTE: Religion in its humility restores man to his only dignity, the courage to live by grace.
AUTHOR: George Santayana

QUOTE: Courage that grows from constitution often forsakes a man when he has occasion for it courage which arises from a sense of duty acts in a uniform manner.
AUTHOR: Joseph Addison

QUOTE: If we are to survive, we must have ideas, vision, and courage. These things are rarely produced by committees. Everything that matters in our intellectual and moral life begins with an individual confronting his own mind and conscience in a room by himself.
AUTHOR: Arthur M. Schlesinger, Jr.

QUOTE: When God speaks, oftentimes His voice will call for an act of courage on our part.
AUTHOR: Charles Stanley

QUOTE: Peace comes when you talk to the guy you most hate. And that's where the courage of a leader comes, because when you sit down with your enemy, you as a leader must already have very considerable confidence from your own constituency.
AUTHOR: Desmond Tutu

QUOTE: We are very much what others think of us. The reception our observations meet with gives us courage to proceed, or damps our efforts.
AUTHOR: William Hazlitt

QUOTE: It takes someone with a vision of the possibilities to attain new levels of experience. Someone with the courage to live his dreams.
AUTHOR: Les Brown

QUOTE: Rather like Batman, I embody the themes of the movie which are the values of family, courage and compassion and a sense of right and wrong, good and bad and justice.
AUTHOR: Gary Oldman

QUOTE: The principal act of courage is to endure and withstand dangers doggedly rather than to attack them.
AUTHOR: Thomas Aquinas

QUOTE: Have the courage to act instead of react.
AUTHOR: Oliver Wendell Holmes

QUOTE: People think I have courage. The courage in my family are my wife Pam, my three daughters, here, Nicole, Jamie, LeeAnn, my mom, who's right here too.
AUTHOR: Jim Valvano

QUOTE: Time is neutral and does not change things. With courage and initiative, leaders change things.
AUTHOR: Jesse Jackson

QUOTE: I'm a big fan of small business ownership. I think it's the backbone of American innovation. But to be successful, you first have to have the courage to go for it.
AUTHOR: Bill Rancic

QUOTE: Is he alone who has courage on his right hand and faith on his left hand?
AUTHOR: Charles Lindbergh

QUOTE: Let a new earth rise. Let another world be born. Let a bloody peace be written in the sky. Let a second generation full of courage issue forth let a people loving freedom come to growth.
AUTHOR: Margaret Walker

QUOTE: In strife who inquires whether stratagem or courage was used?
AUTHOR: Virgil

QUOTE: Often the difference between a successful man and a failure is not one's better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on his ideas, to take a calculated risk, and to act.
AUTHOR: Maxwell Maltz

QUOTE: In fact, my courage and my bravery at a young age was the thing I was bullied for, a kind of 'Who do you think you are?'
AUTHOR: Lady Gaga

QUOTE: There is in true beauty, as in courage, something which narrow souls cannot dare to admire.
AUTHOR: William Congreve

QUOTE: Physical courage, which despises all danger, will make a man brave in one way and moral courage, which despises all opinion, will make a man brave in another.
AUTHOR: Charles Caleb Colton

QUOTE: You have to have courage to be obedient to God.
AUTHOR: Charles Stanley

QUOTE: I'm sick of not having the courage to be an absolute nobody.
AUTHOR: J. D. Salinger

QUOTE: Courage conquers all things: it even gives strength to the body.
AUTHOR: Ovid

QUOTE: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
AUTHOR: Amelia Earhart

QUOTE: The sea - this truth must be confessed - has no generosity. No display of manly qualities - courage, hardihood, endurance, faithfulness - has ever been known to touch its irresponsible consciousness of power.
AUTHOR: Joseph Conrad

QUOTE: Courage, my friends 'tis not too late to build a better world.
AUTHOR: Tommy Douglas

QUOTE: Courage is doing what you are afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you are scared.
AUTHOR: Eddie Rickenbacker

QUOTE: Courage is what preserves our liberty, safety, life, and our homes and parents, our country and children. Courage comprises all things.
AUTHOR: Plautus

QUOTE: Courage is often lack of insight, whereas cowardice in many cases is based on good information.
AUTHOR: Peter Ustinov

QUOTE: The courage of the poet is to keep ajar the door that leads into madness.
AUTHOR: Christopher Morley

QUOTE: Courage is simply the willingness to be afraid and act anyway.
AUTHOR: Robert Anthony

QUOTE: Whether you be man or woman you will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
AUTHOR: James Allen

QUOTE: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.
AUTHOR: Baltasar Gracian

QUOTE: He who loses wealth loses much he who loses a friend loses more but he that loses his courage loses all.
AUTHOR: Miguel de Cervantes

QUOTE: True courage is not the brutal force of vulgar heroes, but the firm resolve of virtue and reason.
AUTHOR: Alfred North Whitehead

QUOTE: At the bottom of not a little of the bravery that appears in the world, there lurks a miserable cowardice. Men will face powder and steel because they have not the courage to face public opinion.
AUTHOR: Edwin Hubbel Chapin

QUOTE: Physical bravery is an animal instinct moral bravery is much higher and truer courage.
AUTHOR: Wendell Phillips

QUOTE: While President Bush likes to project an image of strength and courage, the real truth is that in the presence of his large financial contributors, he is a moral coward.
AUTHOR: Al Gore

QUOTE: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
AUTHOR: Jonas Salk

QUOTE: Success is that old ABC - ability, breaks, and courage.
AUTHOR: Charles Luckman

QUOTE: Audacity augments courage hesitation, fear.
AUTHOR: Publilius Syrus

QUOTE: For this equilibrium now in sight, let us trust that mankind, as it has occurred in the greatest periods of its past, will find for itself a new code of ethics, common to all, made of tolerance, of courage, and of faith in the Spirit of men.
AUTHOR: Albert Claude

QUOTE: The courage of very ordinary people is all that stands between us and the dark.
AUTHOR: Pam Brown

QUOTE: To live we must conquer incessantly, we must have the courage to be happy.
AUTHOR: Henri Frederic Amiel

QUOTE: I have the courage of my convictions.
AUTHOR: Brigitte Bardot

QUOTE: In all realms of life it takes courage to stretch your limits, express your power, and fulfill your potential... it's no different in the financial realm.
AUTHOR: Suze Orman

QUOTE: A wise woman knows how to summon her courage and do what is right, rather than what is easy.
AUTHOR: Suze Orman

QUOTE: It takes vision and courage to create - it takes faith and courage to prove.
AUTHOR: Owen D. Young

QUOTE: Decision is a risk rooted in the courage of being free.
AUTHOR: Paul Tillich

QUOTE: The courage to be is rooted in the God who appears when God has disappeared in the anxiety of doubt.
AUTHOR: Paul Tillich

QUOTE: Soldiers, when committed to a task, can't compromise. It's unrelenting devotion to the standards of duty and courage, absolute loyalty to others, not letting the task go until it's been done.
AUTHOR: John Keegan

QUOTE: America needs jobs, smaller government, less spending and a president with the courage to offer more than yet another speech.
AUTHOR: Rick Perry

QUOTE: If we bring not the good courage of minds covetous of truth, and truth only, prepared to hear all things, and decide upon all things, according to evidence, we should do more wisely to sit down contented in ignorance, than to bestir ourselves only to reap disappointment.
AUTHOR: Frances Wright

QUOTE: I think there's a difference between ditzy and dumb. Dumb is just not knowing. Ditzy is having the courage to ask!
AUTHOR: Jessica Simpson

QUOTE: Values are principles and ideas that bring meaning to the seemingly mundane experience of life. A meaningful life that ultimately brings happiness and pride requires you to respond to temptations as well as challenges with honor, dignity, and courage.
AUTHOR: Laura Schlessinger

QUOTE: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
AUTHOR: Ralph W. Sockman

QUOTE: So the brother in black offers to these United States the source of courage that endures, and laughter.
AUTHOR: Zora Neale Hurston

QUOTE: It requires greater courage to preserve inner freedom, to move on in one's inward journey into new realms, than to stand defiantly for outer freedom. It is often easier to play the martyr, as it is to be rash in battle.
AUTHOR: Rollo May

QUOTE: The best thing to do is stare it in the face and move on. We have to face our fears and plow through. I think taking chances takes a lot more courage than staying stagnant and doing what's safe and comfortable.
AUTHOR: Terri Clark

QUOTE: There's only one requirement of any of us, and that is to be courageous. Because courage, as you might know, defines all other human behavior. And, I believe - because I've done a little of this myself - pretending to be courageous is just as good as the real thing.

QUOTE: Those who won our independence... valued liberty as an end and as a means. They believed liberty to be the secret of happiness and courage to be the secret of liberty.
AUTHOR: Louis D. Brandeis

QUOTE: And I think most people in this country want to see a president that's got the courage to say we're going to cut the tax burden, and reduce the regulatory climate, and we're going to get Americans working.
AUTHOR: Rick Perry

QUOTE: I have no physical courage, I've asked for a double.
AUTHOR: Catherine Deneuve

QUOTE: What has made America amazing has been the fact that throughout our history, throughout the more than 200 years of our history, there have been men and women of courage who stood up and decided it was more important to look out for the future of their children and their grandchildren than their own political futures.
AUTHOR: Scott Walker

QUOTE: Often the difference between a successful person and a failure is not one has better abilities or ideas, but the courage that one has to bet on one's ideas, to take a calculated risk - and to act.
AUTHOR: Andre Malraux

QUOTE: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.
AUTHOR: Clare Boothe Luce

QUOTE: Courage is the capacity to confront what can be imagined.
AUTHOR: Leo Rosten

QUOTE: Patience, that blending of moral courage with physical timidity.
AUTHOR: Thomas Hardy

QUOTE: War alone brings up to their highest tension all human energies and imposes the stamp of nobility upon the peoples who have the courage to make it.

QUOTE: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves, or on whom she simply depends, is want of courage.

QUOTE: Because with courage and conviction I believe we can deliver a more flexible, adaptable and open European Union in which the interests and ambitions of all its members can be met.
AUTHOR: David Cameron

QUOTE: Courage in danger is half the battle.
AUTHOR: Plautus

QUOTE: Courage easily finds its own eloquence.
AUTHOR: Plautus

QUOTE: Good courage in a bad affair is half of the evil overcome.
AUTHOR: Plautus

QUOTE: The courage of a soldier is found to be the cheapest and most common quality of human nature.

QUOTE: Courage is a special kind of knowledge: the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.

QUOTE: My mother taught me that we all have the power to achieve our dreams. What I lacked was the courage.

QUOTE: Every man of courage is a man of his word.

QUOTE: A man of courage never needs weapons, but he may need bail.

QUOTE: As for courage and will - we cannot measure how much of each lies within us, we can only trust there will be sufficient to carry through trials which may lie ahead.

QUOTE: But courage which goes against military expediency is stupidity, or, if it is insisted upon by a commander, irresponsibility.

QUOTE: Cowardice and courage are never without a measure of affectation. Nor is love. Feelings are never true. They play with their mirrors.

QUOTE: Let us go forth with fear and courage and rage to save the world.
AUTHOR: Grace Paley

QUOTE: Washington's answer to a self-inflicted financial crisis reminded Americans why they so deeply distrust the political class. AUTHOR: Ron Fournier

QUOTE: When you make that crossover from life to real life, when you're not treated as a child anymore but as a man, and you are no longer given the benefit of the doubt, it takes some courage to face that.

QUOTE: Fashion should not be expected to serve in the stead of courage or character.
AUTHOR: Loretta Young

QUOTE: We're going to be OK because of the American people. They have more grit, determination and courage than you can imagine.

QUOTE: At the same time, I would add that the American people have a lot of courage.

QUOTE: It takes a lot of courage to face up to things you can't do because we feed ourselves so much denial.

QUOTE: Never undertake anything for which you wouldn't have the courage to ask the blessings of heaven.

QUOTE: Honest conviction is my courage the Constitution is my guide.

QUOTE: The courage to imagine the otherwise is our greatest resource, adding color and suspense to all our life.

QUOTE: Discouragement is not the absence of adequacy but the absence of courage.

QUOTE: Conscience is the root of all true courage if a man would be brave let him obey his conscience.

QUOTE: I always disliked dogs, those protectors of cowards who lack the courage to fight an assailant themselves.
AUTHOR: August Strindberg

QUOTE: You cannot build character and courage by destroying men's initiative and independence.
AUTHOR: William J. H. Boetcker

QUOTE: We are biological creatures. We are born, we live, we die. There is no transcendent purpose to existence. Purged of both hope and fear, we find courage in the face of helplessness, insignificance and uncertainty.

QUOTE: Courage is the art of being the only one who knows you're scared to death.
AUTHOR: Earl Wilson

QUOTE: We learned to be patient observers like the owl. We learned cleverness from the crow, and courage from the jay, who will attack an owl ten times its size to drive it off its territory. But above all of them ranked the chickadee because of its indomitable spirit.

QUOTE: If you could get up the courage to begin, you have the courage to succeed.
AUTHOR: David Viscott

QUOTE: There are no greater treasures than the highest human qualities such as compassion, courage and hope. Not even tragic accident or disaster can destroy such treasures of the heart.

QUOTE: Nothing gives us courage more readily than the desire to avoid looking like a damn fool.

QUOTE: Lying at the root of the social agreements of 1980 are the courage, sense of responsibility, and the solidarity of the working people. Both sides have then recognized that an accord must be reached if bloodshed is to be prevented.

QUOTE: A member must say that he is a member of the Unification Church and that he is the follower of Sun Myung Moon. If he doesn't have the courage to say it, he is not worthy of me.

QUOTE: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?

QUOTE: It's not just Bin Laden or just those that are involved in the counterterrorism effort. We've gotta cast the net broader than that.
