AUTHOR: Dick Cheney

QUOTE: Courage is always rewarded.
AUTHOR: Kenny Loggins

QUOTE: The enchanting charms of this sublime science reveal only to those who have the courage to go deeply into it.
AUTHOR: Carl Friedrich Gauss

QUOTE: With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.
AUTHOR: Margaret Mitchell

QUOTE: What I've always said is that I'm opposed to institutional racism, and I would've, had I've been alive at the time, I think, had the courage to march with Martin Luther King to overturn institutional racism, and I see no place in our society for institutional racism.

QUOTE: I have reached the conclusion that those who have physical courage also have moral courage. Physical courage is a great test.

QUOTE: Wait for the Lord. Behave yourself manfully, and be of good courage. Do not be faithless, but stay in your place and do not turn back.

QUOTE: I went through a long period where I was afraid of doing things I wanted to do, and you get your courage back, which is what's important.

QUOTE: Deep Throat's information, and in my view, courage, allowed the newspaper to use what he knew and suspected.

QUOTE: When you really believe in God, it gives you a courage, a confidence that enables you to meet the things coming.

QUOTE: Men create real miracles when they use their God-given courage and intelligence.

QUOTE: I think that the romantic impulse is in all of us and that sometimes we live it for a short time, but it's not part of a sensible way of living. QUOTE: The older people that one admires seem to be fearless. They go right out into the world. It's astounding. Maybe they can't see or they can't hear, but they walk out into the street and take life as it comes. They're models of courage, in a strange way.

QUOTE: Your determination, selflessness and courage have brought the freedom struggle towards its fulfilment.

QUOTE: One has to have the courage of one's pessimism.

QUOTE: Until the day of his death, no man can be sure of his courage.

QUOTE: Falsehood is cowardice, the truth courage.

QUOTE: I'm still shy - I'm no good at my children's parent-teacher conferences, and I'm slowly learning how to ask for what I want. But I now know that I have a reserve of courage to draw upon when I really need it. There's nothing that I'm too scared to have a go at.

QUOTE: Often the test of courage is not to die but to live.
AUTHOR: Vittorio Alfieri

QUOTE: I have always had the courage for the new things that life sometimes offers.
AUTHOR: Wallis Simpson

QUOTE: Physical courage is a great test.
AUTHOR: Oriana Fallaci

QUOTE: In my old age, I have been thinking about this, and I have reached the conclusion that those who have physical courage also have moral courage.

QUOTE: No, I am not a homosexual. If I were a homosexual, I would hope I would have the courage to say so. What's cruel is that you are forcing me to say I am not a homosexual. This means you are putting homosexuals down. I don't want to do that.
AUTHOR: Ed Koch

QUOTE: Ingenuity, plus courage, plus work, equals miracles.
AUTHOR: Bob Richards

QUOTE: How many women have the courage to start properly with a cold, cold bath early in the morning? I jump in, throw the water, cold as ice, and after the first plunge I am happy.

QUOTE: With courage and character, American soldiers continue to put themselves on the line to defend our freedom, and so many have paid the ultimate sacrifice.

QUOTE: I hope America can also be the cultural leader of the world, and use this frontier spirit to lead and show others that we need courage to go places where we have not gone before.
AUTHOR: Tadao Ando

QUOTE: Australia is a nation of compassion. Courage and compassion. And the third of these great values: resilience.
AUTHOR: Kevin Rudd

QUOTE: You want to shut up every Negro who has the courage to stand up and fight for the rights of his people, for the rights of workers, and I have been on many a picket line for the steelworkers too.
AUTHOR: Paul Robeson

QUOTE: I know that throughout their history, the people of the United States defended their freedom, their liberty, their justice, and their rights - if need be - with their lives. I think their courage is so admirable.
AUTHOR: Lee Myung-bak

QUOTE: War is fear cloaked in courage.
AUTHOR: William Westmoreland

QUOTE: Love makes a subtle man out of a crude one, it gives eloquence to the mute, it gives courage the cowardly and makes the idle quick and sharp.
AUTHOR: Juan Ruiz

QUOTE: Heroes to me are guys that sit in libraries. They absorb knowledge and then the risks they take are calculated on the basis of the courage it took to become replete with knowledge.

QUOTE: The courage of a soldier is heightened by his knowledge of his profession.
AUTHOR: Publius Flavius Vegetius Renatus

QUOTE: Such decisions will be far reaching and difficult. But you never lacked courage in the past. Your courage is now needed for the future.
AUTHOR: Gerry Adams

QUOTE: Courage: Great Russian word, fit for the songs of our children's children, pure on their tongues, and free.
AUTHOR: Anna Akhmatova

QUOTE: Courage is never to let your actions be influenced by your fears.
AUTHOR: Arthur Koestler

QUOTE: To me, there is no greater act of courage than being the one who kisses first.

QUOTE: A life lesson for me is, how do you muster the courage to take on a new risk? Whether it's starting up a business or taking on a new project or expedition. I think the risks that we take are all relative to the risk-taker.

QUOTE: Maybe you will be afraid and maybe you will fail, but the courage to take risks in any part of your life is, I feel, a very worthwhile way to live.

QUOTE: When I was straight, I had the courage and energy to become an actress. I owe my career to my will to stop using.

QUOTE: The one thing I learned the most about acting is it takes a tremendous amount of courage to go there and stand still. It takes courage and guts to step out of your mind frame and depict something.

QUOTE: Courage to continue comes from deeper sources than outward results.

QUOTE: There are always a few who stand up in times of communal madness and have the courage to say that what unites us is greater than what divides us.

QUOTE: September 11, 2001, revealed heroism in ordinary people who might have gone through their lives never called upon to demonstrate the extent of their courage.

QUOTE: Each of us has an inner dream that we can unfold if we will just have the courage to admit what it is. And the faith to trust our own admission. The admitting is often very difficult.

QUOTE: You must have love as the core it takes courage to be willing to constantly tell the truth to each other and risk letting the relationship go.
AUTHOR: Kenny Loggins

QUOTE: Courage is a peculiar kind of fear.
AUTHOR: Charles Kennedy

QUOTE: An able, disinterested, public-spirited press, with trained intelligence to know the right and courage to do it, can preserve that public virtue without which popular government is a sham and a mockery.

QUOTE: Courage is... the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
AUTHOR: David Ben-Gurion

QUOTE: It takes both courage and talent to stand up in front of fellow human beings and make them crack a smile, and at the same time keep it clean.

QUOTE: Wisdom, prudence, forethought, these are essential. But not second to these that noble courage which adventures the right, and leaves the consequences to God.

QUOTE: These rules may seem simple enough, but it will require great morale and physical courage to adhere to them. But if carried out in the strict sense of the word it will surely lead to a greater success than could otherwise be attained.
AUTHOR: Major Taylor

QUOTE: Keep courage. Whatever you do, do not feel sorry for yourself. You will win in a great age of opportunity.
AUTHOR: Richard L. Evans

QUOTE: I find fault with my children because I like them and I want them to go places - uprightness and strength and courage and civil respect and anything that affects the probabilities of failure on the part of those that are closest to me, that concerns me - I find fault.
AUTHOR: Branch Rickey

QUOTE: Leadership requires the courage to make decisions that will benefit the next generation.
AUTHOR: Alan Autry

QUOTE: There's only one thing worse than a man who doesn't have strong likes and dislikes, and that's a man who has strong likes and dislikes without the courage to voice them.

QUOTE: Therefore, don't let sinners take courage to think they will be favoured like the thief on the cross for we see on the other side, they may be like the hardened one, and reproach death itself.

QUOTE: Once I had all the facts in, I found I didn't have the immoral courage to pull the caper. So I wrote it as a story. As a teenager, I didn't have any skills for writing as such, so it came out in 1500 words.

QUOTE: Everybody, even me, sometimes had to compromise on something, doing things we know to be wrong, and this happens doing whatever job in the world. But a singer must have the courage of saying no.

QUOTE: Part of courage is simple consistency.

QUOTE: Whether you be man or woman you will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.

QUOTE: It has been my honor to support and work with President Barack Obama, a man who has brought courage and character to the presidency. President Obama's strength of character leads him to do the right thing, even when it isn't the easy thing.
AUTHOR: Harry Reid

QUOTE: We had no more courage than Harriet Tubman or Marcus Garvey had in their times. We just had a more vulnerable enemy.
AUTHOR: Stokely Carmichael

QUOTE: Pugnacity is a form of courage, but a very bad form.
AUTHOR: Sinclair Lewis

QUOTE: The President regards the Japanese as a brave people but courage, though useful in time of war, is subordinate to knowledge of arts hence, courage without such knowledge is not to be highly esteemed.
AUTHOR: Townsend Harris

QUOTE: The world will step aside for nearly anyone who has the courage of his of her opinions.
AUTHOR: George Weinberg

QUOTE: If one suffers we all suffer. Togetherness is strength. Courage.

QUOTE: I started to send my work to journals when I was 26, which was just a question of when I got the courage up. They were mostly journals I had been reading for the previous six or seven years.

QUOTE: It is up to African leaders to show their will and political courage in order to assure that this new pan-African institution becomes an efficient instrument and not a place for endless discussions.

QUOTE: Peace is a fragile thing. It takes courage to secure it. It takes wisdom to maintain it.

QUOTE: President Obama and our all-of-the-above energy strategy is the real deal. We are proud of the fact that we are importing less oil than at any time in modern history, and it has been because of the president's vision and courage.

QUOTE: I'll know how to die with courage that is easier than living.

QUOTE: I fear some of our leaders today have lost the courage to stand up. What we have now are politicians. They won't offer real plans, and only stand up when they want to blame someone else.

QUOTE: A leader must have the courage to act against an expert's advice.

QUOTE: It takes a great deal of courage to follow another person's lead.

QUOTE: The courage in journalism is sticking up for the unpopular, not the popular.

QUOTE: With his trademark courage and conviction, President Reagan led us out of the Cold War, spreading his vision of freedom, resulting in the release of millions of people from the yoke of communism.

QUOTE: I think laughter may be a form of courage. As humans we sometimes stand tall and look into the sun and laugh, and I think we are never more brave than when we do that.

QUOTE: My sword I give to him that shall succeed me in my pilgrimage, and my courage and skill to him that can get it.

QUOTE: Have the courage of your desire.

QUOTE: I wish we lived in a society that made it safe and provided the courage for everyone to come out.

QUOTE: Courage is very important. Like a muscle, it is strengthened by use.

QUOTE: More firm and sure the hand of courage strikes, when it obeys the watchful eye of caution.

QUOTE: That's what acting is - it's about... having the courage to allow your audience into the private moments of your characters' lives.

QUOTE: The criteria for serving one's country should be competence, courage and willingness to serve. QUOTE: I admired Eugene McCarthy's courage and although I left his Senate staff after four years to accept a job as the researcher on the editorial page of the 'Washington Post,' I remained an admirer.

QUOTE: A man of courage flees forward, in the midst of new things.

QUOTE: When somebody who makes movies for a living - either as an actor, writer, producer or director - lives to be a certain age, you have to admire them. QUOTE: I'm a writer of faith who worries about the intolerance of religion. I look at the past and fear we haven't learned from it. QUOTE: Most of the good executives do pretty well. Because to be a good executive you have to be strong, and you have to have a simple attribute that people have forgotten about - courage.

QUOTE: Americans are gathering the courage to just say no. We are saying no to addictive consumer lifestyles. We are saying no to wars and corporate takeover and the IMF loans that gobble up people and their resources.

QUOTE: Rosa Parks' courage, determination, and tenacity continue to be an inspiration to all those committed to non-violent protest and change nearly half a century later.

QUOTE: Ofttimes the test of courage becomes rather to live than to die.

QUOTE: None speak of the bravery, the might, or the intellect of Jesus but the devil is always imagined as a being of acute intellect, political cunning, and the fiercest courage. These universal and instinctive tendencies of the human mind reveal much.

QUOTE: Martin Luther King, Jr. Day is a time to honor the greatest champion of racial equality who taught a nation - through compassion and courage - about democracy, nonviolence and racial justice.

QUOTE: I took my courage in both hands and went to the Laundromat to do my washing. I had to use three machines.

QUOTE: I love revolutionaries who have the courage to stand up against the status quo. They're always misunderstood, but they're the ones who are standing up for human rights.

QUOTE: To bathe a cat takes brute force, perseverance, courage of conviction - and a cat. The last ingredient is usually hardest to come by.

QUOTE: Give the people not hell, but hope and courage.

QUOTE: Courage ought to have eyes as well as arms.

QUOTE: Whatever enlarges hope will also exalt courage.

QUOTE: They put me in a harness, like a horse, to learn the back somersault. It was weird up there when I put on that harness for the first time. The courage came with practice.

QUOTE: There has to be this pioneer, the individual who has the courage, the ambition to overcome the obstacles that always develop when one tries to do something worthwhile, especially when it is new and different.
AUTHOR: Alfred P. Sloan

QUOTE: If we can't have the courage to tell our constituents, hey, we've got to cut back, then if we can point to something and say, I would like to vote for more benefits for you, but this balanced budget amendment or statutory spending cap or whatever the device is, is preventing me from doing it.

QUOTE: If you set as your goal to roll back the size of government, you have an obligation to answer the tough questions and show real courage, not just appeal to ideology. Treat the voters like adults.

QUOTE: What I love about the East End is that there's a great perseverance, determination and courage. What I dislike about it is that there is sometimes a celebration of ignorance.

QUOTE: Morality may consist solely in the courage of making a choice.
AUTHOR: Leon Blum

QUOTE: Necessity does the work of courage.
AUTHOR: Nicholas M. Butler

QUOTE: Even within the last three or four years, I have a greater ability to communicate, I think. I have more courage to show the stuff... And it does take courage.

QUOTE: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities - because it is the quality which guarantees all others.

QUOTE: A man of character in peace is a man of courage in war.

QUOTE: My definition of courage is never letting anyone define you.

QUOTE: We simply do not understand our place in the universe and have not the courage to admit it.

QUOTE: It's up to the courage of the filmmakers to make art in cinema, not just business. John was rejected by studios, he borrowed money and did movies with his own money. You're either courageous or not. You have to find a way.

QUOTE: I know this president. And I can tell you that he cares deeply about the next generation of young women in this country - his daughters, and everyone's daughters. President Obama had the courage to stand with Sandra Fluke. Without hesitation, he defended her right to tell her story.

QUOTE: People don't follow titles, they follow courage.

QUOTE: Moral courage is higher and a rarer virtue than physical courage.
AUTHOR: William Slim

QUOTE: Support the strong, give courage to the timid, remind the indifferent, and warn the opposed.
AUTHOR: Whitney M. Young

QUOTE: Greatness, in the last analysis, is largely bravery - courage in escaping from old ideas and old standards and respectable ways of doing things.
AUTHOR: James Robinson

QUOTE: I emphasize... that the Harrimans showed great courage and loyalty and confidence in us, because three or four of us were really running the business, the day to day business.
AUTHOR: Prescott Bush

QUOTE: Have the courage to face a difficulty lest it kick you harder than you bargain for.
AUTHOR: Stanislaus I

QUOTE: To him that waits all things reveal themselves, provided that he has the courage not to deny, in the darkness, what he has seen in the light.

QUOTE: Resignation is the courage of Christian sorrow.

QUOTE: There can be a fundamental gulf of gracelessness in a human heart which neither our love nor our courage can bridge.

QUOTE: I know that if I'd had to go and take an exam for acting, I wouldn't have got anywhere. You don't take exams for acting, you take your courage.

QUOTE: You cannot build character and courage by taking away a man's initiative and independence.

QUOTE: I want to encourage our people, to educate our people to have the courage to understand and fight for their rights.

QUOTE: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

QUOTE: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.

QUOTE: All men dream, but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds, wake in the day to find that it was vanity: but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act on their dreams with open eyes, to make them possible.
AUTHOR: T. E. Lawrence

QUOTE: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
AUTHOR: Harriet Tubman

QUOTE: Dream as if you'll live forever. Live as if you'll die today.

QUOTE: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.

QUOTE: A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
AUTHOR: Colin Powell

QUOTE: Sleep is the best meditation.
AUTHOR: Dalai Lama

QUOTE: Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before.
AUTHOR: Edgar Allan Poe

QUOTE: I'm sick of following my dreams. I'm just going to ask them where they're goin', and hook up with them later.
AUTHOR: Mitch Hedberg

QUOTE: My dream is of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope of earth.
AUTHOR: Abraham Lincoln

QUOTE: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with success unexpected in common hours.
AUTHOR: Henry David Thoreau

QUOTE: Reality is wrong. Dreams are for real.
AUTHOR: Tupac Shakur

QUOTE: There are those who look at things the way they are, and ask why... I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?
AUTHOR: Robert Kennedy

QUOTE: Yesterday is but today's memory, and tomorrow is today's dream.
AUTHOR: Khalil Gibran

QUOTE: We all have dreams. But in order to make dreams come into reality, it takes an awful lot of determination, dedication, self-discipline, and effort.

QUOTE: If you take responsibility for yourself you will develop a hunger to accomplish your dreams.
AUTHOR: Les Brown

QUOTE: To accomplish great things, we must not only act, but also dream not only plan, but also believe.

QUOTE: Life's a fight. It's a good fight of faith.

QUOTE: If he have faith, the believer cannot be restrained. He betrays himself. He breaks out. He confesses and teaches this gospel to the people at the risk of life itself.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther

QUOTE: Keep your dreams alive. Understand to achieve anything requires faith and belief in yourself, vision, hard work, determination, and dedication. Remember all things are possible for those who believe.
AUTHOR: Gail Devers

QUOTE: Faith is permitting ourselves to be seized by the things we do not see.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther

QUOTE: Things can fall apart, or threaten to, for many reasons, and then there's got to be a leap of faith. Ultimately, when you're at the edge, you have to go forward or backward if you go forward, you have to jump together.
AUTHOR: Yo-Yo Ma

QUOTE: In a decaying society, art, if it is truthful, must also reflect decay. And unless it wants to break faith with its social function, art must show the world as changeable. And help to change it.
AUTHOR: Ernst Fischer

QUOTE: Reason is the enemy of faith.
AUTHOR: Martin Luther

QUOTE: Faith is the highest passion in a human being. Many in every generation may not come that far, but none comes further.
AUTHOR: Soren Kierkegaard

QUOTE: He that rebels against reason is a real rebel, but he that in defence of reason rebels against tyranny has a better title to Defender of the Faith, than George the Third.
AUTHOR: Thomas Paine

QUOTE: Choose your friends with caution plan your future with purpose, and frame your life with faith.
AUTHOR: Thomas S. Monson

QUOTE: It strikes me as odd that the free exercise of religious faith is sometimes treated as a problem, something America is stuck with instead of blessed with.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: Faith is the sense of life, that sense by virtue of which man does not destroy himself, but continues to live on. It is the force whereby we live.
AUTHOR: Leo Tolstoy

QUOTE: The children have been a wonderful gift to me, and I'm thankful to have once again seen our world through their eyes. They restore my faith in the family's future.
AUTHOR: Jackie Kennedy

QUOTE: Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others.
AUTHOR: Erich Fromm

QUOTE: Faith may be defined briefly as an illogical belief in the occurrence of the improbable.
AUTHOR: H. L. Mencken

QUOTE: The meme for blind faith secures its own perpetuation by the simple unconscious expedient of discouraging rational inquiry.
AUTHOR: Richard Dawkins

QUOTE: No person I have ever met, not even the most righteous or pure of heart, has gone without those times when faith recedes in the busy-ness of life.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: This President takes his inspiration from the capitals of Europe we look to the cities and small towns of America. This President puts his faith in government. We put our faith in the American people.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: Men and women of every faith and good people with none at all sincerely strive to do right and lead a purpose-driven life.
AUTHOR: Mitt Romney

QUOTE: I slept with faith and found a corpse in my arms on awakening I drank and danced all night with doubt and found her a virgin in the morning.
AUTHOR: Aleister Crowley

QUOTE: There is but one cause of human failure. And that is man's lack of faith in his true Self.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: A library implies an act of faith.
AUTHOR: Victor Hugo

QUOTE: We must not sit still and look for miracles up and doing, and the Lord will be with thee. Prayer and pains, through faith in Christ Jesus, will do anything.
AUTHOR: George Eliot

QUOTE: Our faith is faith in someone else's faith, and in the greatest matters this is most the case.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: Whatever universe a professor believes in must at any rate be a universe that lends itself to lengthy discourse. A universe definable in two sentences is something for which the professorial intellect has no use. No faith in anything of that cheap kind!
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: Faith, mighty faith, the promise sees, And looks to God alone Laughs at impossibilities, And cries it shall be done.
AUTHOR: Charles Wesley

QUOTE: It is only by risking our persons from one hour to another that we live at all. And often enough our faith beforehand in an uncertified result is the only thing that makes the result come true.
AUTHOR: William James

QUOTE: Forgiveness is like faith. You have to keep reviving it.
AUTHOR: Mason Cooley

QUOTE: To be an atheist requires an indefinitely greater measure of faith than to recieve all the great truths which atheism would deny.
AUTHOR: Joseph Addison

QUOTE: Faith is the first factor in a life devoted to service. Without it, nothing is possible. With it, nothing is impossible.
AUTHOR: Mary McLeod Bethune

QUOTE: There is nothing wrong with America that faith, love of freedom, intelligence, and energy of her citizens cannot cure.
AUTHOR: Dwight D. Eisenhower

QUOTE: Anybody who has been seriously engaged in scientific work of any kind realizes that over the entrance to the gates of the temple of science are written the words: 'Ye must have faith.'
AUTHOR: Max Planck

QUOTE: Man must cease attributing his problems to his environment, and learn again to exercise his will - his personal responsibility in the realm of faith and morals.
AUTHOR: Albert Schweitzer

QUOTE: If children understand that beliefs should be substantiated with evidence, as opposed to tradition, authority, revelation or faith, they will automatically work out for themselves that they are atheists.
AUTHOR: Richard Dawkins

QUOTE: Faith means living with uncertainty - feeling your way through life, letting your heart guide you like a lantern in the dark.
AUTHOR: Dan Millman

QUOTE: Faith: Belief without evidence in what is told by one who speaks without knowledge, of things without parallel.
AUTHOR: Ambrose Bierce

QUOTE: No human race is superior no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong. Only racists make them.
AUTHOR: Elie Wiesel

QUOTE: Not brute force but only persuasion and faith are the kings of this world.
AUTHOR: Thomas Carlyle

QUOTE: Amidst the confusion of the times, the conflicts of conscience, and the turmoil of daily living, an abiding faith becomes an anchor to our lives.
AUTHOR: Thomas S. Monson

QUOTE: In other words, a person who is fanatic in matters of religion, and clings to certain ideas about the nature of God and the universe, becomes a person who has no faith at all.
AUTHOR: Alan Watts

QUOTE: A great city, whose image dwells in the memory of man, is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest Faith hovers over the towers of Jerusalem and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world, Art.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: It is the heart which perceives God and not the reason. That is what faith is: God perceived by the heart, not by the reason.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: Love, like a chicken salad or restaurant hash, must be taken with blind faith or it loses its flavor.
AUTHOR: Helen Rowland

QUOTE: No lover, if he be of good faith, and sincere, will deny he would prefer to see his mistress dead than unfaithful.

QUOTE: I had faith in Israel before it was established, I have in it now. I believe it has a glorious future before it - not just another sovereign nation, but as an embodiment of the great ideals of our civilization.

QUOTE: Only our individual faith in freedom can keep us free.
AUTHOR: Dwight D. Eisenhower

QUOTE: There lives more faith in honest doubt, believe me, than in half the creeds.
AUTHOR: Alfred Lord Tennyson

QUOTE: Faith is different from proof the latter is human, the former is a Gift from God.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: A better world shall emerge based on faith and understanding.
AUTHOR: Douglas MacArthur

QUOTE: Talk unbelief, and you will have unbelief but talk faith, and you will have faith. According to the seed sown will be the harvest.

QUOTE: Faith is much better than belief. Belief is when someone else does the thinking.
AUTHOR: R. Buckminster Fuller

QUOTE: Practice means to perform, over and over again in the face of all obstacles, some act of vision, of faith, of desire. Practice is a means of inviting the perfection desired.
AUTHOR: Martha Graham

QUOTE: Faith is a state of openness or trust.
AUTHOR: Alan Watts

QUOTE: Politics is an act of faith you have to show some kind of confidence in the intellectual and moral capacity of the public.
AUTHOR: George McGovern

QUOTE: If you desire to be pure, have firm faith, and slowly go on with your devotional practices without wasting your energy in useless scriptural discussions and arguments. Your little brain will otherwise be muddled.
AUTHOR: Ramakrishna

QUOTE: Faith certainly tells us what the senses do not, but not the contrary of what they see it is above, not against them.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: The parents have a right to say that no teacher paid by their money shall rob their children of faith in God and send them back to their homes skeptical, or infidels, or agnostics, or atheists.

QUOTE: I have an almost complete disregard of precedent, and a faith in the possibility of something better. It irritates me to be told how things have always been done. I defy the tyranny of precedent. I go for anything new that might improve the past.
AUTHOR: Clara Barton

QUOTE: I'm grateful to God for His bountiful gifts... He gave me courage and faith in myself.
AUTHOR: Loretta Young

QUOTE: It is a masterpiece of the devil to make us believe that children cannot understand religion. Would Christ have made a child the standard of faith if He had known that it was not capable of understanding His words?
AUTHOR: Dwight L. Moody

QUOTE: Faith embraces many truths which seem to contradict each other.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: We like security: we like the pope to be infallible in matters of faith, and grave doctors to be so in moral questions so that we can feel reassured.
AUTHOR: Blaise Pascal

QUOTE: Painting is a faith, and it imposes the duty to disregard public opinion.
AUTHOR: Vincent Van Gogh

QUOTE: Question: Why are we Masters of our Fate, the captains of our souls? Because we have the power to control our thoughts, our attitudes. That is why many people live in the withering negative world. That is why many people live in the Positive Faith world.
AUTHOR: Alfred A. Montapert

QUOTE: Duty cannot exist without faith.
AUTHOR: Benjamin Disraeli

QUOTE: No matter how corrupt and unjust a convict may be, he loves fairness more than anything else. If the people placed over him are unfair, from year to year he lapses into an embittered state characterized by an extreme lack of faith.
AUTHOR: Anton Chekhov

QUOTE: Blind faith, no matter how passionately expressed, will not suffice. Science for its part will test relentlessly every assumption about the human condition.
AUTHOR: E. O. Wilson

QUOTE: It is a great consolation for me to remember that the Lord, to whom I had drawn near in humble and child-like faith, has suffered and died for me, and that He will look on me in love and compassion.

QUOTE: When you're thirsty and it seems that you could drink the entire ocean that's faith when you start to drink and finish only a glass or two that's science.
AUTHOR: Anton Chekhov

QUOTE: Do I think faith will be an important part of being a good president? Yes, I do.
AUTHOR: George W. Bush

QUOTE: Faith and doubt cannot exist in the same mind at the same time, for one will dispel the other.
AUTHOR: Thomas S. Monson

QUOTE: Faith moves mountains, but you have to keep pushing while you are praying.
AUTHOR: Mason Cooley

QUOTE: I was very, very religious. And of course I wrote about it in 'Night.' I questioned God's silence. So I questioned. I don't have an answer for that. Does it mean that I stopped having faith? No. I have faith, but I question it.
AUTHOR: Elie Wiesel

QUOTE: Life is a battle between faith and reason in which each feeds upon the other, drawing sustenance from it and destroying it.
AUTHOR: Reinhold Niebuhr

QUOTE: We have convinced over one billion members of the Islamic faith that we are prejudiced against their religion, that we would deny them freedom of religion, that we want suppress their culture and invade their governments.
AUTHOR: Theodore C. Sorensen

QUOTE: A mission is a place where you ask nonbelievers to come and find faith and hope and feel love.
AUTHOR: Robert H. Schuller

QUOTE: Faith is part of who I am, yes. I was raised Christian Scientist. The most important thing I saw every single week on the wall at Sunday school was the Golden Rule.

QUOTE: Faith is an aptitude of the spirit. It is, in fact, a talent: you must be born with it.
AUTHOR: Anton Chekhov

QUOTE: With faith, discipline and selfless devotion to duty, there is nothing worthwhile that you cannot achieve.
AUTHOR: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

QUOTE: Faith that it's not always in your hands or things don't always go the way you planned, but you have to have faith that there is a plan for you, and you must follow your heart and believe in yourself no matter what.

QUOTE: Patience and Diligence, like faith, remove mountains.
AUTHOR: William Penn

QUOTE: Blind faith in your leaders, or in anything, will get you killed.

QUOTE: Faith consists in being vitally concerned with that ultimate reality to which I give the symbolical name of God. Whoever reflects earnestly on the meaning of life is on the verge of an act of faith.

QUOTE: The truth of our faith becomes a matter of ridicule among the infidels if any Catholic, not gifted with the necessary scientific learning, presents as dogma what scientific scrutiny shows to be false.
AUTHOR: Thomas Aquinas

QUOTE: You can do very little with faith, but you can do nothing without it.
AUTHOR: Samuel Butler

QUOTE: Faith - you can do very little with it, but you can do nothing without it.
AUTHOR: Samuel Butler

QUOTE: What is faith but a kind of betting or speculation after all? It should be, I bet that my Redeemer liveth.
AUTHOR: Samuel Butler

QUOTE: We can never learn too much of His will towards us, too much of His messages and His advice. The Bible is His word and its study gives at once the foundation for our faith and an inspiration to battle onward in the fight against the tempter.

QUOTE: When prayer removes distrust and doubt and enters the field of mental certainty, it becomes faith and the universe is built on faith.

QUOTE: Faith in a holy cause is to a considerable extent a substitute for lost faith in ourselves.

QUOTE: Faith is not believing that God can. It is knowing that God will.

QUOTE: People who believe they have the power to exercise some measure of control over their lives are healthier, more effective and more successful than those who lack faith in their ability to effect changes in their lives.

QUOTE: For modes of faith let graceless zealots fight, His can't be wrong whose life is in the right.
AUTHOR: Alexander Pope

QUOTE: At least the fundamentalists haven't tried to dilute their message. Their faith is exposed for what it is for all to see.
AUTHOR: Richard Dawkins

QUOTE: Bad faith likes discourse on friendship and loyalty.
AUTHOR: Mason Cooley

QUOTE: By any reasonable measure of achievement, the faith of the Enlightenment thinkers in science was justified.

QUOTE: Although a man may wear fine clothing, if he lives peacefully and is good, self-possessed, has faith and is pure and if he does not hurt any living being, he is a holy man.

QUOTE: How many things we held yesterday as articles of faith which today we tell as fables.

QUOTE: The mysteries of faith are degraded if they are made into an object of affirmation and negation, when in reality they should be an object of contemplation.

QUOTE: Getting ahead in a difficult profession requires avid faith in yourself. That is why some people with mediocre talent, but with great inner drive, go so much further than people with vastly superior talent.

QUOTE: It is part of my faith as a Muslim to try to help those who are suffering from poverty or economic or political injustice.

QUOTE: I have no mystic faith in the people. I have in the individual.

QUOTE: The infinite faith I have in people's ability to understand anything that makes sense has always been justified, finally, by their behavior.

QUOTE: As a people of faith, we know that prayer is a powerful instrument. And as one Nation under God, we know that many times our most powerful tool is prayer.

QUOTE: Nothing which is true or beautiful or good makes complete sense in any immediate context of history therefore we must be saved by faith.

QUOTE: Do not tell secrets to those whose faith and silence you have not already tested.

QUOTE: Writing fiction has become a priestly business in countries that have lost their faith.

QUOTE: Faith begins where Reason sinks exhausted.

QUOTE: To disbelieve is easy to scoff is simple to have faith is harder.

QUOTE: If you think you can win, you can win. Faith is necessary to victory.

QUOTE: Faith crosses every border and touches every heart in every nation.
AUTHOR: George W. Bush

QUOTE: Writing is an act of faith, not a trick of grammar.
AUTHOR: E. B. White

QUOTE: If I advocate cautious optimism it is not because I do not have faith in the future but because I do not want to encourage blind faith.
AUTHOR: Aung San Suu Kyi

QUOTE: A sublime faith in human imbecility has seldom led those who cherish it astray.
AUTHOR: Havelock Ellis

QUOTE: That willing suspension of disbelief for the moment, which constitutes poetic faith.

QUOTE: You cannot be President of the United States if you don't have faith. Remember Lincoln, going to his knees in times of trial in the Civil War and all that stuff.

QUOTE: Corruption is nature's way of restoring our faith in democracy.
AUTHOR: Peter Ustinov

QUOTE: Happy is the son whose faith in his mother remains unchallenged.
AUTHOR: Louisa May Alcott

QUOTE: Religion is part of the human make-up. It's also part of our cultural and intellectual history. Religion was our first attempt at literature, the texts, our first attempt at cosmology, making sense of where we are in the universe, our first attempt at health care, believing in faith healing, our first attempt at philosophy.
AUTHOR: Christopher Hitchens

QUOTE: Hold firmly that our faith is identical with that of the ancients. Deny this, and you dissolve the unity of the Church.
AUTHOR: Thomas Aquinas

QUOTE: The difficulties we face originate from one of three sources. Some are sent to us by the Lord to test our faith, others are the result of Satan's attacks, and still others are due to our own sinful choices.
AUTHOR: Charles Stanley

QUOTE: The separation of church and state is a source of strength, but the conscience of our nation does not call for separation between men of state and faith in the Supreme Being.
AUTHOR: Lyndon B. Johnson

QUOTE: Is it faith to understand nothing, and merely submit your convictions implicitly to the Church?
AUTHOR: John Calvin

QUOTE: Faith is an excitement and an enthusiasm: it is a condition of intellectual magnificence to which we must cling as to a treasure, and not squander on our way through life in the small coin of empty words, or in exact and priggish argument.

QUOTE: It's very important that every movie I do makes money because I want the people that had the faith in me to get their money back.
AUTHOR: Quentin Tarantino

QUOTE: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than You, and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
AUTHOR: Judy Collins

QUOTE: All that I say is, examine, inquire. Look into the nature of things. Search out the grounds of your opinions, the for and against. Know why you believe, understand what you believe, and possess a reason for the faith that is in you.

QUOTE: Let judges secretly despair of justice: their verdicts will be more acute. Let generals secretly despair of triumph killing will be defamed. Let priests secretly despair of faith: their compassion will be true.

QUOTE: There is greatness in the fear of God, contentment in faith of God, and honour in humility.
AUTHOR: Abu Bakr

QUOTE: An atheist may be simply one whose faith and love are concentrated on the impersonal aspects of God.

QUOTE: Is he alone who has courage on his right hand and faith on his left hand?
AUTHOR: Charles Lindbergh

QUOTE: I respect faith, but doubt is what gives you an education.
AUTHOR: Wilson Mizner

QUOTE: Workers have kept faith in American institutions. Most of the conflicts, which have occurred have been when labor's right to live has been challenged and denied.

QUOTE: To know a person's religion we need not listen to his profession of faith but must find his brand of intolerance.

QUOTE: If there was no faith there would be no living in this world. We could not even eat hash with any safety.

QUOTE: The man who radiates good cheer, who makes life happier wherever he meets it, is always a man of vision and faith.
AUTHOR: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

QUOTE: If I were dying my last words would be: Have faith and pursue the unknown end.
AUTHOR: Oliver Wendell Holmes

QUOTE: Where there is the necessary technical skill to move mountains, there is no need for the faith that moves mountains.
AUTHOR: Eric Hoffer

QUOTE: Take away hatred from some people, and you have men without faith.

QUOTE: To 'choose' dogma and faith over doubt and experience is to throw out the ripening vintage and to reach greedily for the Kool-Aid.

QUOTE: Obedience is an act of faith disobedience is the result of unbelief.
AUTHOR: Edwin Louis Cole

QUOTE: Faith is the virtue by which, clinging-to the faithfulness of God, we lean upon him, so that we may obtain what he gives to us.
AUTHOR: William Ames

QUOTE: I've lost my faith in science.
AUTHOR: Bette Davis

QUOTE: What I learned growing up on the farm was a way of life that was centered on hard work, and on faith and on thrift. Those values have stuck with me my whole life.
AUTHOR: Rick Perry

QUOTE: I don't think that the total creation took place in six days as we now measure time. If we can confirm, say, the Big Bang theory, that doesn't at all cause me to question my faith that God created the Big Bang.

QUOTE: I believe that if we really want human brotherhood to spread and increase until it makes life safe and sane, we must also be certain that there is no one true faith or path by which it may spread.
AUTHOR: Adlai E. Stevenson

QUOTE: I found a religion that blended scientific reason with spiritual reality in a unifying faith far removed from the headlines of violence, destruction and terrorism.
AUTHOR: Cat Stevens

QUOTE: The first holy truth in God 101 is that men and women of true faith have always had to accept the mystery of God's identity and love and ways. I hate that, but it's the truth.

QUOTE: Action and faith enslave thought, both of them in order not be troubled or inconvenienced by reflection, criticism, and doubt.
AUTHOR: Henri Frederic Amiel

QUOTE: The origin of the absurd idea of immortal life is easy to discover it is kept alive by hope and fear, by childish faith, and by cowardice.
AUTHOR: Clarence Darrow

QUOTE: Trust is not the same as faith. A friend is someone you trust. Putting faith in anyone is a mistake.
AUTHOR: Christopher Hitchens

QUOTE: There's been some research in cognitive science, I'm told, that discloses that there have always been perhaps 10 to 15 percent of people who are, as Pascal puts it, so made that they cannot believe. To us, when people talk about faith, it's white noise.
AUTHOR: Christopher Hitchens

QUOTE: Base souls have no faith in great individuals.
AUTHOR: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

QUOTE: I looked at some of the statues of Jesus they were just stones with no life. When they said that God is three, I was puzzled even more but could not argue. I believed it, simply because I had to have respect for the faith of my parents.
AUTHOR: Cat Stevens

QUOTE: Those who love him love that he sells the most art they take it as a point of faith that this proves Kinkade is the best. But his fans don't only rely on this supply-and-demand justification. They go back to values.
AUTHOR: Jerry Saltz

QUOTE: Between understanding and faith immediate connections must subsist.
AUTHOR: Marquis de Sade

QUOTE: Art requires neither complaisance nor politeness nothing but faith, faith and freedom.
AUTHOR: Gustave Flaubert

QUOTE: I think there ought to be a strict separation or wall built between our religious faith and our practice of political authority in office. I don't think the President of the United States should extoll Christianity if he happens to be a Christian at the expense of Judaism, Islam or other faiths.
AUTHOR: Jimmy Carter

QUOTE: For this equilibrium now in sight, let us trust that mankind, as it has occurred in the greatest periods of its past, will find for itself a new code of ethics, common to all, made of tolerance, of courage, and of faith in the Spirit of men.
AUTHOR: Albert Claude

QUOTE: My gut feelings and my faith tell me that until God shuts a door, no human can shut it.
AUTHOR: Olusegun Obasanjo

QUOTE: My faith helps me understand that circumstances don't dictate my happiness, my inner peace.
AUTHOR: Denzel Washington

QUOTE: Faith Hill is a big role model.
AUTHOR: Taylor Swift

QUOTE: Wal-Mart doesn't really care about your faith. Wal-Mart cares if you have money to spend, and it is going to be as generic as possible in exploiting the holiday season for every buck it can make.
AUTHOR: Richard Roeper

QUOTE: People look at me and see a calm, cool guy on the sidelines and I want them to know that my Christian faith affects my coaching and everything I do.
AUTHOR: Tony Dungy

QUOTE: An unexamined faith is not worth having, for fundamentalism and uncritical certitude entail the rejection of one of the great human gifts: that of free will, of the liberty to make up our own minds based on evidence and tradition and reason.

QUOTE: Let the people who never find true love keep saying that there's no such thing. Their faith will make it easier for them to live and die.
AUTHOR: Wislawa Szymborska

QUOTE: Look at the Afghans, during the time of the Soviet invasion. They were among the poorest Muslims in the world, yet they were sustained by their faith in God, and God alone.
AUTHOR: Abu Bakar Bashir

QUOTE: Faith without works is like a bird without wings though she may hop with her companions on earth, yet she will never fly with them to heaven.
AUTHOR: Francis Beaumont

QUOTE: Our national motto is 'In God we Trust,' reminding us that faith in our Creator is the most important American value of all.
AUTHOR: Marco Rubio

QUOTE: You just have to have a simple faith.
AUTHOR: Jimmy Carter

QUOTE: In religious and in secular affairs, the more fervent beliefs attract followers. If you are a moderate in any respect - if you're a moderate on abortion, if you're a moderate on gun control, or if you're a moderate in your religious faith - it doesn't evolve into a crusade where you're either right or wrong, good or bad, with us or against us.
AUTHOR: Jimmy Carter

QUOTE: Faith is an act of a finite being who is grasped by, and turned to, the infinite.
AUTHOR: Paul Tillich

QUOTE: They are the weakest, however strong, who have no faith in themselves or their own powers.
AUTHOR: Christian Nestell Bovee

QUOTE: Prayer is as natural an expression of faith as breathing is of life.
AUTHOR: Jonathan Edwards

QUOTE: I have to ask Allah's forgiveness and not get angry, because they come to me out of love, and it's not fitting that I should turn to them in hatred.
AUTHOR: Abdul Qadeer Khan

QUOTE: We think that forgiveness is weakness, but it's absolutely not it takes a very strong person to forgive.
AUTHOR: T. D. Jakes

QUOTE: Murder is unique in that it abolishes the party it injures, so that society has to take the place of the victim and on his behalf demand atonement or grant forgiveness it is the one crime in which society has a direct interest.
AUTHOR: W. H. Auden

QUOTE: I realized that it's all really one, that John Lennon was correct. We utilize the music to bring down the walls of Berlin, to bring up the force of compassion and forgiveness and kindness between Palestines, Hebrews. Bring down the walls here in San Diego, Tijuana, Cuba.
AUTHOR: Carlos Santana

QUOTE: I did a lot of things that I regretted and I certainly paid for my mistakes. You have to go and ask for forgiveness and it wasn't until I really started doing good and doing right, by other people as well as myself, that I really started to feel that guilt go away. So I don't have a problem going to sleep at night.
AUTHOR: Mark Wahlberg

QUOTE: The fact is there is forgiveness for those who seek God. And I believe in the power of redemption.
AUTHOR: Rick Perry

QUOTE: I think the first step is to understand that forgiveness does not exonerate the perpetrator. Forgiveness liberates the victim. It's a gift you give yourself.

QUOTE: Soon I realized that if beauty equalled forgiveness, I was never going to be forgiven.

QUOTE: We cannot embrace God's forgiveness if we are so busy clinging to past wounds and nursing old grudges.

QUOTE: Forgiveness to the injured does belong but they ne'er pardon who have done wrong.
AUTHOR: John Dryden

QUOTE: God's forgiveness allows us to be honest with ourselves. We recognize our imperfections, admit our failures, and plead to God for clemency.

QUOTE: If Jesus Christ was who He claimed to be, and He did die on a cross at a point of time in history, then, for all history past and all history future it is relevant because that is the very focal point for forgiveness and redemption.
AUTHOR: Josh McDowell

QUOTE: We win by tenderness. We conquer by forgiveness.
AUTHOR: Frederick William Robertson

QUOTE: The schools would fail through their silence, the Church through its forgiveness, and the home through the denial and silence of the parents. The new generation has to hear what the older generation refuses to tell it.

QUOTE: It is always the case that when the Christian looks back, he is looking at the forgiveness of sins.

QUOTE: I find forgiveness to be really healthy.

QUOTE: My desire is to stand up and brush myself off when I make mistakes and ask for forgiveness.

QUOTE: Forgiveness really is so misunderstood, as well as the power it can release in an individual.

QUOTE: I think it's important to remember that Christianity was based in love and tolerance and forgiveness and acceptance.

QUOTE: I think we learn the most from imperfect relationships - things like forgiveness and compassion.

QUOTE: On a level of simple personal survival, understanding and forgiveness are crucial... whether in an intimate personal relationship or on a global level.

QUOTE: When there's that forgiveness present and compassion, it just helps you live so much easier.

QUOTE: Forgiveness is indifference. Forgiveness is impossible while love lasts.

QUOTE: 'Caught' is a novel of forgiveness, and the past and the present - who should be and who shouldn't be forgiven. None of my books are ever just about thrills, or it won't work.

QUOTE: To sin offers repentance and forgiveness not to sin offers only punishment.

QUOTE: I like cast iron coated with enamel for longevity and forgiveness if I happen to take my eyes off the prize while pouring Chianti.

QUOTE: One important theme is the extent to which one can ever correct an error, especially outside any frame of religious forgiveness. All of us have done something we regret - how we manage to remove that from our conscience, or whether that's even possible, interested me.

QUOTE: Forgiveness is the needle that knows how to mend.

QUOTE: Well, I've never left my faith - but have I made a lot of mistakes? But was I fortunate that I was brought up in that Pentecostal church, where I heard about God's love and God's forgiveness.
AUTHOR: Billy Ray Cyrus

QUOTE: On the Day of Atonement, Jews are commanded to seek forgiveness from the people we have hurt.
AUTHOR: Laura Schlessinger

QUOTE: The Dalai Lama's entire being is about peace and harmony, forgiveness and self-discipline. Those are qualities to be admired. I am really looking forward to meeting His Holiness.
AUTHOR: Joe Nichols

QUOTE: As we know, forgiveness of oneself is the hardest of all the forgivenesses.
AUTHOR: Joan Baez

QUOTE: I think it is important that we rebuild an atmosphere of forgiveness and civility in every aspect of our lives.
AUTHOR: T. D. Jakes

QUOTE: I believe in Jesus Christ as my Lord and savior. I believe that Jesus died for my sins, and rose again, and that's my belief. I still don't know what 'Christian' means. I'm a follower of Christ, but I keep making a whole bunch of mistakes. And I thank God for forgiveness.
AUTHOR: Sherri Shepherd

QUOTE: I ask the people of Connecticut for their forgiveness, I should have paid more attention to people around me and people that I trusted but I am sorry for my actions and take full responsibility.
AUTHOR: John Rowland

QUOTE: God's forgiveness is the only thing. And, well, I take full responsibility for the adultery. It was my fault and, you know, no matter what went on, the man has to take responsibility and I do.
AUTHOR: Jim Bakker

QUOTE: Well, of course I think people can be forgiven. But our justice system is not set up to dispense forgiveness. You can go to the local priest for that.

QUOTE: Forgiveness isn't about condoning what has happened to you or someone else's actions against you.
AUTHOR: Jennifer O'Neill

QUOTE: Sometimes I see myself fine, sometimes I need a witness. And I like the whole truth, but there are nights I only need forgiveness.
AUTHOR: Dar Williams

QUOTE: There is no forgiveness in nature.
AUTHOR: Ugo Betti

QUOTE: I am making amends and seeking forgiveness. My only hope is that some good can come out of my situation.
AUTHOR: Jayson Blair

QUOTE: I'm a lapsed Quaker. I don't go to meetings any more. But I'm very drawn to Catholicism - all that glitter. I'd love to be a Catholic. I think it would be fantastic - faith, forgiveness, absolution, extreme unction - all these wonderful words. I don't think anyone who was ever born a Catholic hasn't died a Catholic, no matter how lapsed they are.
AUTHOR: Kate Atkinson

QUOTE: China's idea of fair trade is government subsidies of its textile and apparel exports to the United States, currency manipulation, and forgiveness of loans by its government banks.
AUTHOR: Virginia Foxx

QUOTE: The things the writers have me doing on 'Suburgatory' are insane. I think they think it's easier to ask for forgiveness than permission.
AUTHOR: Cheryl Hines

AUTHOR: Lee Tergesen

QUOTE: I'm currently in an interesting correspondence with a nun about forgiveness.
AUTHOR: Julian Clary

QUOTE: I invite everyone to chose forgiveness rather than division, teamwork over personal ambition.
AUTHOR: Jean-Francois Cope

QUOTE: I would say the hierarchy has made terrible errors in judgment and it has to seek forgiveness by its members.
AUTHOR: William P. Leahy

QUOTE: I discipline churchgoers with godly lessons and sharp words if they do not change their ways. My goal is to open their hearts so that they seek forgiveness.

QUOTE: These subsidies from four European governments, which include aircraft launch assistance, capital injections, debt forgiveness, have enabled Airbus to develop and range market airliners well below cost.

QUOTE: I really do believe that God is love, one of deep affection and grace and forgiveness and inspiration.
AUTHOR: William P. Young

QUOTE: Forgiveness is not to give the other person peace. Forgiveness is for you. Take that opportunity.

QUOTE: And the only thing to do with a sin is to confess, do penance and then, after some kind of decent interval, ask for forgiveness.

QUOTE: Any story about revenge is ultimately a story about forgiveness, redemption, or the futility of revenge.

QUOTE: Freedom prospers when religion is vibrant and the rule of law under God is acknowledged.
AUTHOR: Ronald Reagan

QUOTE: For to be free is not merely to cast off one's chains, but to live in a way that respects and enhances the freedom of others.

QUOTE: If you want total security, go to prison. There you're fed, clothed, given medical care and so on. The only thing lacking... is freedom.

QUOTE: I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do. I am free, no matter what rules surround me. If I find them tolerable, I tolerate them if I find them too obnoxious, I break them. I am free because I know that I alone am morally responsible for everything I do.

QUOTE: Freedom is not worth having if it does not connote freedom to err.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: The desire of gold is not for gold. It is for the means of freedom and benefit.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.

QUOTE: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
AUTHOR: Soren Kierkegaard

QUOTE: You have freedom when you're easy in your harness.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
AUTHOR: Jean-Paul Sartre

QUOTE: The only sure bulwark of continuing liberty is a government strong enough to protect the interests of the people, and a people strong enough and well enough informed to maintain its sovereign control over the goverment.
AUTHOR: Franklin D. Roosevelt

QUOTE: The truth is I love being alive. And I love feeling free. So if I can't have those things then I feel like a caged animal and I'd rather not be in a cage. I'd rather be dead. And it's real simple. And I think it's not that uncommon.

QUOTE: We must be willing to pay a price for freedom.
AUTHOR: H. L. Mencken

QUOTE: Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.

QUOTE: Perfect freedom is as necessary to the health and vigor of commerce as it is to the health and vigor of citizenship.

QUOTE: Is freedom anything else than the right to live as we wish? Nothing else.

QUOTE: For in the end, freedom is a personal and lonely battle and one faces down fears of today so that those of tomorrow might be engaged.

QUOTE: The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good, in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs, or impede their efforts to obtain it.

QUOTE: Freedom is a man's natural power of doing what he pleases, so far as he is not prevented by force or law.

QUOTE: I hope for nothing. I fear nothing. I am free.

QUOTE: Freedom is the sure possession of those alone who have the courage to defend it.

QUOTE: Do not allow to slip away from you freedoms the people who came before you won with such hard knocks.

QUOTE: I'm a big advocate of freedom: freedom of speech, freedom of expression, freedom of thought.

QUOTE: We will not waver we will not tire we will not falter, and we will not fail. Peace and Freedom will prevail.

QUOTE: None who have always been free can understand the terrible fascinating power of the hope of freedom to those who are not free.

QUOTE: All theory is against freedom of the will all experience for it.

QUOTE: I believe we are on an irreversible trend toward more freedom and democracy - but that could change.

QUOTE: You cannot parcel out freedom in pieces because freedom is all or nothing.

QUOTE: Heresy is another word for freedom of thought.

QUOTE: We do not commonly see in a tax a diminution of freedom, and yet it clearly is one.

QUOTE: Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle. And so we must straighten our backs and work for our freedom. A man can't ride you unless your back is bent.

QUOTE: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
AUTHOR: Jim Morrison

QUOTE: Expose yourself to your deepest fear after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.

QUOTE: If the freedom of speech is taken away then dumb and silent we may be led, like sheep to the slaughter.

QUOTE: Freedom is never voluntarily given by the oppressor it must be demanded by the oppressed.

QUOTE: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.

QUOTE: Our greatest happiness does not depend on the condition of life in which chance has placed us, but is always the result of a good conscience, good health, occupation, and freedom in all just pursuits.

QUOTE: The sweltering summer of the Negro's legitimate discontent will not pass until there is an invigorating autumn of freedom and equality.

QUOTE: The best road to progress is freedom's road.

AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: It is by the goodness of God that in our country we have those three unspeakably precious things: freedom of speech, freedom of conscience, and the prudence never to practice either of them.

QUOTE: Freedom lies in being bold.

QUOTE: In giving freedom to the slave, we assure freedom to the free - honorable alike in what we give and what we preserve. We shall nobly save, or meanly lose, the last best hope of earth.

QUOTE: Conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.

QUOTE: In the long history of the world, only a few generations have been granted the role of defending freedom in its hour of maximum danger. I do not shrink from this responsibility - I welcome it.

QUOTE: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you're a man, you take it.

QUOTE: Freedom is never dear at any price. It is the breath of life. What would a man not pay for living?
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: I am involved in a freedom ride protesting the loss of the minority rights belonging to the few remaining earthbound stars. All we demanded was our right to twinkle.
AUTHOR: Marilyn Monroe

QUOTE: Violent means will give violent freedom. That would be a menace to the world and to India herself.
AUTHOR: Mahatma Gandhi

QUOTE: The path we have chosen for the present is full of hazards, as all paths are. The cost of freedom is always high, but Americans have always paid it. And one path we shall never choose, and that is the path of surrender, or submission.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: I am interested in anything about revolt, disorder, chaos-especially activity that seems to have no meaning. It seems to me to be the road toward freedom... Rather than starting inside, I start outside and reach the mental through the physical.
AUTHOR: Jim Morrison

QUOTE: If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all.
AUTHOR: Noam Chomsky

QUOTE: I am a Republican, a black, dyed in the wool Republican, and I never intend to belong to any other party than the party of freedom and progress.
AUTHOR: Frederick Douglass

QUOTE: A hero is someone who understands the responsibility that comes with his freedom.
AUTHOR: Bob Dylan

QUOTE: I'm interested in anything about revolt, disorder, chaos, especially activity that appears to have no meaning. It seems to me to be the road toward freedom.
AUTHOR: Jim Morrison

QUOTE: We cannot expect that all nations will adopt like systems, for conformity is the jailer of freedom and the enemy of growth.
AUTHOR: John F. Kennedy

QUOTE: I believe there are more instances of the abridgement of freedom of the people by gradual and silent encroachments by those in power than by violent and sudden usurpations.

QUOTE: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.

QUOTE: Americans are so enamored of equality that they would rather be equal in slavery than unequal in freedom.

QUOTE: Every human has four endowments- self awareness, conscience, independent will and creative imagination. These give us the ultimate human freedom... The power to choose, to respond, to change.

QUOTE: It is cruel, you know, that music should be so beautiful. It has the beauty of loneliness of pain: of strength and freedom. The beauty of disappointment and never-satisfied love. The cruel beauty of nature and everlasting beauty of monotony.

QUOTE: The revelation of thought takes men out of servitude into freedom.
AUTHOR: Ralph Waldo Emerson

QUOTE: Freedom means you are unobstructed in living your life as you choose. Anything less is a form of slavery.

QUOTE: What is ominous is the ease with which some people go from saying that they don't like something to saying that the government should forbid it. When you go down that road, don't expect freedom to survive very long.

QUOTE: Money won't create success, the freedom to make it will.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: Well, if crime fighters fight crime and fire fighters fight fire, what do freedom fighters fight? They never mention that part to us, do they?

QUOTE: I think my first album opened a lot of doors for me to push the freedom of speech to the limit.
AUTHOR: Eminem

QUOTE: Nothing has been purchased more dearly than the little bit of reason and sense of freedom which now constitutes our pride.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Nietzsche

QUOTE: Responsibility is the price of freedom.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: A free press can, of course, be good or bad, but, most certainly without freedom, the press will never be anything but bad.

QUOTE: A free America... means just this: individual freedom for all, rich or poor, or else this system of government we call democracy is only an expedient to enslave man to the machine and make him like it.

QUOTE: Let freedom reign. The sun never set on so glorious a human achievement.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: The framers of our Constitution meant we were to have freedom of religion, not freedom from religion.

QUOTE: Communists have always played an active role in the fight by colonial countries for their freedom, because the short-term objects of Communism would always correspond with the long-term objects of freedom movements.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: If society fits you comfortably enough, you call it freedom.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: The only certain freedom's in departure.
AUTHOR: Robert Frost

QUOTE: I am just absolutely convinced that the best formula for giving us peace and preserving the American way of life is freedom, limited government, and minding our own business overseas.
AUTHOR: Ron Paul

QUOTE: Where globalization means, as it so often does, that the rich and powerful now have new means to further enrich and empower themselves at the cost of the poorer and weaker, we have a responsibility to protest in the name of universal freedom.

QUOTE: Without freedom, no art art lives only on the restraints it imposes on itself, and dies of all others.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: I think of a hero as someone who understands the degree of responsibility that comes with his freedom.

QUOTE: Every tyrant who has lived has believed in freedom for himself.
AUTHOR: Elbert Hubbard

QUOTE: Religious liberty is the first freedom in our Constitution. And whether the cause is justice for the persecuted, compassion for the needy and the sick, or mercy for the child waiting to be born, there is no greater force for good in the nation than Christian conscience in action.

QUOTE: I believe in a religion that believes in freedom. Any time I have to accept a religion that won't let me fight a battle for my people, I say to hell with that religion.

QUOTE: Without culture, and the relative freedom it implies, society, even when perfect, is but a jungle. This is why any authentic creation is a gift to the future.

QUOTE: Men are never really willing to die except for the sake of freedom: therefore they do not believe in dying completely.
AUTHOR: Albert Camus

QUOTE: Only free men can negotiate prisoners cannot enter into contracts. Your freedom and mine cannot be separated.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: There is no such thing as part freedom.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: We, the People, recognize that we have responsibilities as well as rights that our destinies are bound together that a freedom which only asks what's in it for me, a freedom without a commitment to others, a freedom without love or charity or duty or patriotism, is unworthy of our founding ideals, and those who died in their defense.
AUTHOR: Barack Obama

QUOTE: Freedom from effort in the present merely means that there has been effort stored up in the past.
AUTHOR: Theodore Roosevelt

QUOTE: You can have peace. Or you can have freedom. Don't ever count on having both at once.
AUTHOR: Robert A. Heinlein

QUOTE: I live in America. I have the right to write whatever I want. And it's equaled by another right just as powerful: the right not to read it. Freedom of speech includes the freedom to offend people.
AUTHOR: Brad Thor

QUOTE: The liberties of our country, the freedom of our civil constitution, are worth defending against all hazards: And it is our duty to defend them against all attacks.
AUTHOR: Samuel Adams

QUOTE: Our single most important challenge is therefore to help establish a social order in which the freedom of the individual will truly mean the freedom of the individual.
AUTHOR: Nelson Mandela

QUOTE: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
AUTHOR: Friedrich Schiller

QUOTE: Freedom consists not in doing what we like, but in having the right to do what we ought.
AUTHOR: Pope John Paul II

QUOTE: This is the highest wisdom that I own freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.
AUTHOR: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

QUOTE: Books were my pass to personal freedom. I learned to read at age three, and soon discovered there was a whole world to conquer that went beyond our farm in Mississippi.

QUOTE: If you're not ready to die for it, put the word 'freedom' out of your vocabulary.
AUTHOR: Malcolm X

QUOTE: When freedom does not have a purpose, when it does not wish to know anything about the rule of law engraved in the hearts of men and women, when it does not listen to the voice of conscience, it turns against humanity and society.
